498~15~Inverted Row (on hips)~Body Weight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Lay on back with belly under fixed horizontal bar. Bend knees and position feet on floor. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.~Keeping hips on floor and low back straight, pull torso up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.~Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See Gravity Vectors for greater understanding of how body angle influences resistance. Also known as Body Row on Hips or Supine Row on Hips.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR2eIlfzHVT3yNfF0_uOuJvzpY-ACqsKyRG4bqU1A_pOt9enQcbneuTtOig9Q&amp

499~16~Machine-assisted Chin-up~Assisted (machine)~Basic~Compound~Pull~Step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip. Kneel onto platform or step onto bar.~Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~See suggested mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to stand on platform or bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation. Also see self-assisted technique without machine.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcS-Gcj5aYGNeUnRADdj0_Mz9JJiA6-N4LgiI06YbTwmSuYnGuNBVquKaqZqwpE&amp

500~16~Machine-assisted Parallel Close Grip Pull-up~Assisted (machine)~Basic~Compound~Pull~Step up and grasp parallel grips. Kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.~Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~See suggested mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require standing on bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQdPj8PuXnmc53bTIfvbLuNFhmFU_CAQlfkuRL1tp42s5av_94pMX85EbM8fg&amp

501~16~Machine-assisted Parallel Close Grip Pull-up (standing)~Assisted (machine)~Basic~Compound~Pull~Step up and grasp parallel grips. Step down onto assistance lever or platform.~Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~See suggested mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to kneel on platform instead of standing on bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQdPj8PuXnmc53bTIfvbLuNFhmFU_CAQlfkuRL1tp42s5av_94pMX85EbM8fg&amp

502~16~Machine-assisted Pull-up~Assisted (machine)~Basic~Compound~Pull~Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.~Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~See suggested mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to stand on bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation. Range of motion will decrease if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRxdiNHyivLTnGS_e5PSYYft_ItaHfuuNfwMnb7yCSXyD6M4Z46B2Lm5fP_qw&amp

503~16~Machine-assisted Pull-up (open-centered bar)~Assisted (machine)~Basic~Compound~Pull~Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.~Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~See suggested mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to stand on bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation. Range of motion will decrease if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSjfWBXvdIEBVnXdfqT3Hk8jS_sotHc6xWCX9mPwtauXGw-7w_qW5PLUgNCzQ&amp

504~16~Machine-assisted Pull-up (open-centered bar, standing)~Assisted (machine)~Basic~Compound~Pull~Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Step down onto assistance lever or platform.~Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Some assisted machines require you to kneel on platform instead of standing on bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation. Range of motion will decrease if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSjfWBXvdIEBVnXdfqT3Hk8jS_sotHc6xWCX9mPwtauXGw-7w_qW5PLUgNCzQ&amp

505~16~Barbell Pullover~Barbell~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent slightly.~With elbows bent slightly, lower bar over and beyond head until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.~Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see Barbell Bent Arm Pullover.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcS1fvjhdYWhUuwcfcEoprXfwJOnTgK5pVboBuXwEQokyELcmjjCD9VGVwEdTQo&amp

506~16~Barbell Bent Arm Pullover~Barbell~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent approximately 90°.~With elbow bent, lower bar over and just behind head until upper arm is approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.~Keep elbows bent approximately 90° throughout exercise. Keep hips from raising up significantly. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see Barbell Pullover.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQmYMFRkC4_6l67J87-FpoRI_Cfkg6bvscrz-wd09nj4un58WTB3XQytz0zsZA&amp

507~16~Cable Close Grip Pulldown~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Grasp parallel cable attachment. Sit with thighs under supports.~Pull down cable attachment to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Exercise can be performed with V-Bar or Multi-exercise Bar.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQGwvznqNAs08l1dZk81Zt1lG7lyBK8p7hq-ILo6pr8A1-6Wx1InG-gmujgyTw&amp

508~16~Cable Alternating Close Grip Pulldown~Cable~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.~Pull down one cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.~Stirrups are attached to split pulley.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTEykXvS-hW6SyEj0P07HjxEWxVhZ2ZzS-NdMydC17jr8oH5KZ5GO4GJjlzdg&amp

509~16~Cable One Arm Pulldown~Cable~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Grasp stirrup in one hand. Sit with thighs under supports.~Pull down cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat and continue with other arm.~Muscles listed as Stabilizers become Synergists if spinal lateral flexion occurs during exercise.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTLnecrMQFZA5aHBXsOwb12zTM9pqFZwvkFCBohctSB0u5Dqqe7_Ak1HDjptA&amp

510~16~Cable One Arm Kneeling Pulldown~Cable~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Grasp stirrup in one hand and kneel on floor.~Pull down cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat and continue with other arm.~Muscles listed as Stabilizers become Synergists if spinal lateral flexion occurs during exercise.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR_PHJ0vU_nXIJYlwpZW9O0I4LSGJOCmVmcqb4nfwJSm9CFC81G_o12Wz4Eig&amp

511~16~Cable Close Grip Pulldown (stirrups)~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.~Pull down cable attachments to sides of chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Stirrups are attached to split pulley.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSS9R0qxu0ikz53KzjhMLZU8oU_CL56ulAOdhCPEPEOJX88Cznxxq3lR014QYA&amp

512~16~Cable Kneeling Bent-over Pulldown~Cable~Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Kneel on mat slightly away from high pulley. Grasp cable rope attachment with both hands. Sit with hips back and bend down by flexing hips so torso is bent over at approximately 30º angle. Allow resistance on cable pulley to pull arms upward with elbows bent.~Pull cable rope down until elbows are back and inside of rope attachment is behind neck. Return attachment over head until shoulder is completely flexed upward. Repeat.~Keep hips and torso in same position throughout movement.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTO3d9eaz0DTtph47MjuI3KDD26BNUFRlilUTeqfKSMMoO6cuMfOjnfP3xtZQ&amp

513~16~Cable Pulldown~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Grasp cable bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.~Pull down cable bar to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT1m2AKGzJTLRJblTTgLyIi5QfHi1yNUvl2UH-G4x8jTmjrbn-GpUiB4nvAaw&amp

514~16~Cable Alternating Pulldown~Cable~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.~Pull down one cable attachment to front side shoulder. Return until arm and shoulder are fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.~Stirrups are attached to split pulley.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcS13ZAWoUf-AtMis3CZtT8tmWGyp97M9wDk4R6SKZ24WxO0pJvB9pZBDKczdA&amp

515~16~Cable Parallel Grip Pulldown~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Grasp parallel cable attachment. Sit with thighs under supports.~Pull down cable attachment to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Parallel Grip Cable Attachment is shorter than Pro Lat Bar, yet longer than Close Grip Cable Attachments.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR26zCxHGaczqiMCLKm8s3W_0sLCWsal1oOb64TmAt98Fn9OA8XWaQ8yIqfIGs&amp

516~16~Cable Pulldown (pro lat bar)~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Grasp pro lat bar with wide parallel grip. Sit with thighs under supports.~Pull down cable bar to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSZ1JBMB-bTFeWqHQO5bjZek8ZFz171hyIC5Mj9UoMoe6LHgT_KbEEjI6t8-jY&amp

517~16~Cable Pulldown (stirrups)~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.~Pull down cable attachments to front sides of shoulders. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Stirrups are attached to split pulley.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRnRgoYzpBhgX0mu_it1nXaPrbsWieNz67h8tdK8rnTL_VvSlI0K4PiH6vb0AM&amp

518~16~Cable Pullover~Cable~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly, so hips are slightly lower than torso. Grasp revolving barbell cable attachment from behind. Pull to position cable attachment over chest. Fix elbows with small bend.~Lower cable attachment toward pulley with elbows bent only slightly. Lower until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are in-line with upper torso. Raise cable attachment over head and continue toward lower body until cable becomes very close to head. Repeat.~Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSF2vk8VK9AhXTLRvpLVZw0JygOoxJnujHlybbNsnvHt28g6Ak5-O_puvo3HKs&amp

519~16~Cable Bent-over Pullover~Cable~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Face high pulley and grasp revolving cable attachment with arm slightly bent. Place one foot slightly back and bend over at hip until shoulder is fully flexed (upper arms at sides of head).~With elbows fixed approximately 30°, pull cable attachment down until upper arms are to sides. Return attachment overhead. Repeat.~Fix elbows approximately 30° throughout exercise. Also known as Straight Arm Pulldown.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRHgm38u51d7JeLTZXOPfV2UGROcXOlcCRicQzBUXoTdIwhso0x1p6AWhXDXA&amp

520~16~Cable Seated Pullover~Cable~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Sit on bench facing away from cable pulley apparatus. Grasp revolving cable attachment over head with overhand grip.~With elbows fixed with slight bend, pull cable attachment forward and down as far as possible. Return cable attachment forward and overhead. Repeat.~If cable attachment is too high, grasp attachment first, then sit down. Fix elbows approximately 30° throughout exercise. Also known as Cable Seated Straight Arm Pulldown.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcS4BTG2wQdyOjzvPkA602-5NJ6Up2sroX9AGTSHXhj-aJdKETlaeYaIJILebA&amp

521~16~Cable Chin-up~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt chains. Step up and grasp bars with shoulder width underhand grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.~Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~If weight bottoms out at bottom, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQkwgcDSSYCcfSMHQZzQG0EBj7mfyJxLLMH7ew40I9y5pv1q1lS-IXWawle1Mk&amp

522~16~Cable Parallel Close Grip Pull-up~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Place dip belt around waist. Kneel as close as possible to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt in front between legs. Step up and grasp close grip p   arallel bars with hands facing inward. Lift legs off of steps or floor.~Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRKZT9p0jJ9eQ50siNuV5BaCxDmxdnBbNXD_Y6Ym94tanXjNcMc8VuA5R8Z1w&amp

523~16~Cable Parallel Grip Pull-up~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Place dip belt around waist. Kneel as close as possible to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt in front between legs. Step up and grasp parallel bars with hands facing inward. Lift legs off of steps or floor.~Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~This particular apparatus could arguably be referred to as lever machine since dip belt attaches to lever arm, although relatively free movement between lever and dip belt offers qualities similar to cable machine. If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQPchiZFJtqLqTSC3agLZeAOR7k0GLlkwUp5a_8eRLEgH0SG1NKbZOJMs9-fA&amp

524~16~Cable Pull-up~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt. Step up and grasp bars with overhand wide grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.~Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRmtUblOLc2dUOhsZOzkmNBE0ecZWvSXmuxdPA5_prTtbTMxeUHg0Xj72KX2Q&amp

525~16~Cable Rear Pull-up~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt. Step up and grasp bars with overhand wide grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.~Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~If weight bottoms out at bottom of motion, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTk-QsOMAV1DScYBowKCSBpf8k1oeqt5CWAtKvcyhC_syRR_sXLMADq5rBGGJ0&amp

526~16~Cable Rear Pulldown~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Grasp cable bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.~Pull cable bar down behind neck. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT1m2AKGzJTLRJblTTgLyIi5QfHi1yNUvl2UH-G4x8jTmjrbn-GpUiB4nvAaw&amp

527~16~Cable Alternating Standing Pulldown~Cable~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Grasp stirrups in each hand. Lean forward and step back with one foot so stance is staggered. Position hands with underhand or neutral grip.~Pull down one cable attachment to front of shoulder. Return until arm and shoulder are fully extended. Repeat movement with opposite arm, alternating between sides.~Video shows appartus with stirrups attached to dual pulley.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTYPXNVKV479q6M3yEEVaDDlEuBl9pNkl6J7Cypq-iExndyq7SSYd2H69v0VZA&amp

528~16~Cable Simultaneous Alternating Standing Pulldown~Cable~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Grasp stirrups in each hand. Lean forward and step back with one foot so stance is staggered. Bend forward knee slightly. Position hands with underhand or neutral grip.~Pull down left cable attachment to front of shoulder. Pull right cable attachment down to front of other shoulder while returning left cable attachment to front of shoulder. Repeat movement with both arms in opposite pattern by pulling left cable attachment while returning right pully attachment. Continuing by alternating movement pattern between sides.~Video shows appartus with stirrups attached to dual pulley.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSgipcxMFcyJBJiB9eU1f5QzqBHOQ2xp7b27LmziQefzqbtwPESZ3wGtCBzxW8&amp

529~16~Cable Twisting Standing Overhead Pull~Cable~Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Stand facing very high pulley. Grasp stirrup in one hand and step back so arm is straight. With leg of opposite side as loaded arm, plant forefoot far back on floor. Slightly bend knee of forward leg, same direction as foot.~Pull down cable attachment to side of chest and rotate body toward side of pulling arm. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.~In standing position, both spinal rotation and hip rotation contribute to body&#39
column2: s rotation. Because rear leg is only supported by forefoot, hip of forward leg is utilized (hip internal rotation / transverse adduction) much greater than hip of rear leg since forward leg offers more secured base of support.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRgdBEJ7AntahcOo45Kc6-MFKeP8TxhG1edvM7e6AY5BSrN2VX9NZkdOxXvl6Q&amp

column2: s rotation. Because rear leg is only supported by forefoot, hip of forward leg is utilized (hip internal rotation / transverse adduction) much greater than hip of rear leg since forward leg offers more secured base of support.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRgdBEJ7AntahcOo45Kc6-MFKeP8TxhG1edvM7e6AY5BSrN2VX9NZkdOxXvl6Q&amp

Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Erector Spinae can become slightly engaged when torso arches back.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQiRzn8LZzXEhgkpKXazeH2JKNyS4R6EG1Sn8mSA3p4GNsU3MhUbYLdRtG0AA&amp

564~16~Band-assisted Chin-up~Band-assisted~Basic~Compound~Pull~Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip while keeping banded leg straight.~Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Free foot can be placed inside of band (as shown) or on top of foot in band for safety in case band slips from foot. At conclusion of set, step down with free foot at bottom of exercises. Dismount band by grasping each side of exercise band, stretch exercise band down, and step out. Continuing to hold on to each side of band while allowing band to contract to normal length.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTlOi6aoPluKz5uPWU9EvCyYhfWFka6cXukbslVxCbBPpZkDOjBlzHRGu6Ca6s&amp

Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp bars angled inward with underhand shoulder width grip while keeping banded leg straight.~Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Free foot can be placed to side of other foot (as shown) or on top of foot in band for safety in case band slips from foot. At conclusion of set, step down with free foot at bottom of exercises. Dismount band by grasping each side of exercise band, stretch exercise band down, and step out. Continuing to hold on to each side of band while allowing band to contract to normal length.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSoUiJAeRNdEXStGEjo1LJHWAOCPACZnPq-1ikwFLrL3-uYzOL6XtM0BE6KOg&amp

Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip while keeping banded leg straight.~Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Free foot can be placed on top of foot in band for safety in case band slips from foot. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTD4yJg1hAhSLmtOPcnyYBYs56Pw9D0u3yAeeUHRK3TA6-TarWpwQNYrbqMW-o&amp

Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Range of motion will decrease if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRPhYS09G4RKnhL3QxBLl1TXpWhAlvBhuPr9yrq2CR09LTtgoYkrTrGoRlHxzQ&amp

569~16~Band-assisted Parallel Grip Pull-up~Band-assisted~Basic~Compound~Pull~Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp parallel bars while keeping banded leg straight.~Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Free foot can be placed inside of band (as shown) or on top of foot in band for safety in case band slips from foot. At conclusion of set, step down with free foot at bottom of exercises. Dismount band by grasping each side of exercise band, stretch exercise band down, and step out. Continuing to hold on to each side of band while allowing band to contract to normal length.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSoUiJAeRNdEXStGEjo1LJHWAOCPACZnPq-1ikwFLrL3-uYzOL6XtM0BE6KOg&amp

570~16~Band-assisted Rear Pull-up~Band-assisted~Basic~Compound~Pull~Grasp middle of hanging exercise band and pull down to side of leg. Lift foot and hook band under heel. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Face perpendicular under pullup bar and position band behind body. Pull band apart and place other foot onto band so both feet are together inside of band. Reach up and grasp pull-up bar with overhand wide grip while keeping legs straight.~Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. At conclusion of set, step one foot out of band at bottom of exercises. Grasping each side of exercise band from behind and pull down. Transfer body weight onto free leg, bend knee of banded leg, release band from underfoot, and step out. Transfer both sides of taut band to one hand behind body. Turn body to side of hand holding band while permitting band to contract to normal length.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQOdBQAnquSs9mINLObNFAd8tR-20NOEU2A689a1GD6JYPM0nSkdsxm8nv2Rlc&amp

579~16~Partner-assisted Pull-up~Assisted (partner)~Basic~Compound~Pull~Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. 581~16~Self-assisted Chin-up~Self-assisted~Basic~Compound~Pull~Stand facing fixed horizontal bar at neck height. Grasp bar with underhand grip shoulder width. Position feet forward on floor, slightly in front of bar.~Lower body under bar until arms and shoulders are fully extended. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping flat on floor. Pull body up until elbows are to sides, again with minimal assistance from lower body. Repeat.~If lower body is used for assistance, Hip and Knee Extensors muscles are utilized. Back extensors may be activated minimally as stabilizer through spine.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQzdkltNBCcphev1aw1ww_gX6LJ43ji-bG0uCRjim0FaOUjzGPzQ_fBQESmEA&amp

582~16~Self-assisted Pull-up~Self-assisted~Basic~Compound~Pull~Stand facing fixed horizontal bar at neck height. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Position feet forward on floor, slightly in front of bar.~Lower body under bar until arms and shoulders are fully extended. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping flat on floor. Pull body up until chin is just above bar, again with minimal assistance from legs. Repeat.~If lower body is used for assistance, Hip and Knee Extensors muscles are utilized. Back extensors may be activated minimally as stabilizer through spine. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRsPQLVX7kwaRCHsJ_YkI3ZrEe6mUpGAKKMZo5fX-r05TuJZcGkBUHfsTn8fVs&amp

583~16~Self-assisted Rear Pull-up~Self-assisted~Basic~Compound~Pull~Grasp bar with overhand wide grip. Position forefeet on floor just behind low bar or on bench just behind high bar.~Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent allowing knees to bend. Pull body up until bar touches back of neck, again with minimal assistance from lower body. Repeat.~If bar is too low, knees may need to spread apart at bottom of motion (as shown) to achieve full range of motion. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. If lower body is used for assistance, Quadriceps are utilized.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQzdkltNBCcphev1aw1ww_gX6LJ43ji-bG0uCRjim0FaOUjzGPzQ_fBQESmEA&amp

584~16~Suspended Pull-up~Suspension~Basic~Compound~Pull~Grasp high suspension handles.~Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.~This exercise can be performed on adjustable length gymnastics rings or a dual anchored suspension trainer where the handles can be placed a short distance apart. Performing this exercise on a TRXⓇ style suspension trainer would require a narrower grip, with the hands closer together.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSXpRLzerX1aHYeMpgfX9_rCJNJyPC4NDCj38uwimX8VEAmwseakp6J9PK8kQ&amp

585~16~Suspended Self-assisted Pull-up~Suspension~Basic~Compound~Pull~Stand facing suspension handles placed at neck height. Grasp handles and position feet forward on floor, slightly in front of handles.~Lower body under handles until arms and shoulders are fully extended. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping flat on floor. Pull body up until chin is just above handles, again with minimal assistance from legs. Repeat.~If lower body is used for assistance, Hip and Knee Extensors muscles are utilized. Back extensors may be activated minimally as stabilizer through spine. Range of motion will be compromised if handles are too wide apart.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRMw8IQwyhsZKUjrhEgMPPP4vY0yYcA6lkxoP9bGbAK60Sj7ztCUmtTNeoJRw&amp

592~16~Rear Pull-up~Body Weight~Basic~Compound~Pull~Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip.~Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. 593~16~Suspended Kneeling Rollout~Suspended~Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Kneel on floor or mat and grasp suspension trainer handles. Position body upright with subtle bend through hip. Also, straighten arms in front of body with slight bend.~Lean body forward while maintaining small bend in hip. Allow arms to bend forward to sides of head. Bend over as far as possible. Raise body back up by pulling arms back until kneeling upright in original position. Repeat.~Try to keep elbows nearly straight throughout exercise. Target muscle, Rectus Abdominis practically contracts isometrically since only a small degree of waist flexion occurs under resistance and, with the assistance of the External Oblique, act to stabilize spine. See target muscle of rollout question. Also, see Spot Reduction Myth and Lower Ab Myth.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSyoWAL1ecsiI2IoBkJS5xtjhZwCJi67Rvt4yeBMbMMaDqfzOhJhchBKz7ldnE&amp

604~17~Cambered Barbell Seated Shrug~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Sit on end of bench and grasp cambered bar from beneath with overhand or mixed grip.~Elevate shoulders as high as possible. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRgV0ntXH9jEcO1nfdYPILajCSdW07r8o2Hnz2izaJwqtzxwRA6IMCthEuwfQ&amp

Lower and repeat.~Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate, depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTClGzZkcw65zJe4ALTCCenhGdyJ9ql2n75MWB3eCT2aUAgp_Z-tPk8b58drw&amp

608~17~Cable Shrug~Cable~Basic or Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Stand facing low pulley and grasp cable bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Stand close to pulley.~With arms straight, elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.~Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Lower and repeat.~Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate, depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSC9V3kBisA46S8TV2OBxM2k3Pk82WZLWUqKhKus0pEiYN9VE4HW-D73xKxUQ&amp

For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Lower and repeat.~Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQ90z9mlaZK7_LJUBIx8D7dT9DDSuAbjINzU_XT02GD1TdovInmMY53pHRLZLo&amp

For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. 614~17~Lever Gripless Shrug (plate loaded)~Lever (plate loaded)~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Stand with shoulders under padded lever.~Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSl4-QWl1lxJ5vze0JaOHXlpVw8LtkTrp25pLDLu2LBJ23dKC2TJ2jy8fQIdQ&amp

654~22~Cable Seated Shoulder External Rotation~Cable~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Sit with side to low pulley. Grasp dumbbell cable attachment with far arm. Position elbow against side and forearm across belly.~Pull cable attachment away from body by externally rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Exercise may be performed standing with medium high pulley.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQd5tkxfcuT-KY_x2GzCFojoD6nc42IE3uHeebmqm52vlHKNTh-bG165jvKeQ&amp

Position elbow against side and forearm across belly.~Pull cable attachment away from body as far as possible by externally rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Turn around and continue with opposite arm.~Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Exercise may be performed seated on chair with pulley lowered to elbow height or seated on floor with low pulley.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTk97wc7mgEZ5niKzQAKP47fPrJafANEe6oi_9wmWnh0703rM2VQrID7afpedY&amp

656~22~Cable Upright Shoulder External Rotation~Cable~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Stand facing low to medium height cable pulley. Grasp stirrup attachment and position bent elbow shoulder height out to side with forearm in line with cable.~Pull stirrup up and back as far as possible. Return by lowering stirrup to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.~Wrist may be kept straighter throughout movement than what is shown. Also, keep elbow at shoulder height and bent at right angle. Height of cable pulley is dependent upon:~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRcFSsWwp9Swu6UMr-_hPgAhOFSeVDRcKC2WyzNUIWMNUAYQW52s4sOl3Akeg&amp

657~22~Dumbbell Lying Shoulder External Rotation~Dumbbell~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lie on side with legs separated for support. Grasp dumbbell and position elbow against side and forearm across belly.~Lift dumbbell by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Flip over and continue with opposite arm.~Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Placing towel roll under arm increase infraspinatus and teres minor EMG signal activity compared to no towel roll (Wilk KE 2002), although subsequent study found no significant difference (Reinold MM 2004). Also see Dumbbell Shoulder External Rotation Errors.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRa5e_WR-IHnkMZEA_ZuDbvgcZVQfOen88WlMCfQMZOigEh30OrnkuHDE92bPg&amp

Flip body over and continue with opposite arm.~Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Position incline as low as possible so dumbbell can still be aligned against gravity.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRI8ZEQI-6f6eI36dJj9oiVENWntbN2RRtezQedBC2pJMostLEhWHYIsYEN1w&amp

Grasp dumbbell with one hand and position forearm vertically with upper arm perpendicular to body.~Lift dumbbell forward and upward by externally rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Grasp with opposite hand, position bent arm out to side of body, and perform with other arm.~Maintain fixed 90° angle elbow position directly lateral to shoulder throughout exercise. Also see Dumbbell Shoulder External Rotation Errors.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR0C03QVCgstYkxgrTYfQzR-cCN-jhFoMinRBQ4D7-DpKXxn8vzalJJXg3iWeY&amp

660~22~Dumbbell Prone Incline External Rotation~Dumbbell~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lie supine on incline bench with legs extended down to each side. Grasp with opposite hand, position bent arm out to side of body, and perform with other arm.~Maintain fixed 90° angle elbow position directly lateral to shoulder throughout exercise. Lower Trapezius acts as stabilizer at lower bench angles whereas Upper Trapezius may act as stabilizer and higher bench angles. Also see Dumbbell Shoulder External Rotation Errors.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQ9ZjzTWfQUYK75uMp3lX9hnhgYHSNtdn6MXQKaD-sOOLtulfOkYn2XdDtk1Q&amp

column1: 663~22~Dumbbell Upright Shoulder External Rotation (with support)~Dumbbell~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Stand or sit with side against chest height platform. 664~22~Lever Shoulder External Rotation (plate loaded)~Lever (plate loaded)~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lie supine on section of bench nearest pads to each side. Position body so shoulders and elbows are aligned to fulcrum on each side. Place wrists or back of hands on under upper set of pads to each side.~Pull both lever arms back and down as far as possible to each side of head by simultaneously rotating upper arms. Lower lever arms to original position and repeat.~Those with shorter forearms whose wrists do not make contact with pad would utilize Wrist Extensors as stabilizer to keep wrists ridged while back of the hands move pads.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcS95y_FNkg-j_knq5tOpSkkYGC7Afhqc1U71o0B1WOvhDu2rZ4N5skJNufqVV4&amp

Repeat with opposite arm.~Before pulling pole forward, attempt to orientate pole as vertical as possible and elbow of lower arm as close to lateral of shoulder as possible.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTm14vv8VQtewZIJMq5bFynuJDgGOpRp1EnuUtIuKQNTgj0IMei8kjtEjrM6A&amp

669~22~Seated Bent-over Infraspinatus Stretch~Stretch~~~~~~ None.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQq6mEHBHiRLfj2JmZE11UYDnI-3FgXht9AgZpOOkDy92FxVrPxAVzVC_oIAQ&amp

670~22~Side Lying Infraspinatus Stretch~Stretch~~~~~~Lean torso toward positioned arm if stretch is not yet felt.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTB_p70a4SXEn0BTn9V9B6agv34YMNXw34l04CGNjtfNhobieWfWDJh4Wc-p7k&amp
671~22~Side Lying Teres Minor Stretch~Stretch~~~~~~ None.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR8bkf_kBKOs_XlUg-rIJLlPV8Ws_401byAjn4w9_c-8rrYa4U5CQZYRui0lmg&amp

672~22~Supine Infraspinatus Stretch~Stretch~~~~Lie supine on mat or floor with legs bent and feet on floor. Bend elbows 90º and position to side of shoulders with back of upper arm on floor.~Keeping elbows bend at a right angles, push forearms downward toward floor and hold stretch.~ None.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQQPmAHupQxNqLB4ltPWBXBBMmepmoAn8uuyX6a0WVqwm0eAM7d9om__C4_Aw&amp

673~22~Prone Infraspinatus Stretch~Stretch~~~~Lie prone on mat or floor. Extend arms out to each side on floor.  Bend elbows 90º and position back of hands to sides of body.~Lower bend arms toward floor and hold stretch.~Upper arms will end up perpendicular to torso while forearms will be parallel.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSEx8WgLtHtCg2Eq-ClXQ8MftFrxNsuTy2Aa2E5XX91jhMbBIChrsHdSwI6JQ&amp

674~22~Suspended Shoulder External Rotation~Suspended~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Grasp suspension handles and position bent elbows to each sides of waist.~Pull handles apart from each side, while keeping fixed elbow position and body and legs straight throughout movement. Raise forward so handles are to each side of body. Return back until handles come back together in front of body. Repeat.~A very upright position (ie: very light resistance) with one foot positioned back slightly (see &#39
column3: ) is typically required for proper execution. Take care to maintain tension on suspension trainer near top of movement. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright or stepping out at top of movement. This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRNvXmHDFufw2cEDuOHMfBMp14d9y8_H5WTSIDMXvLUp4t-Gh9Ub52D3r3jVw&amp

column1: 675~23~Cable Seated Shoulder Internal Rotation~Cable~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Sit with side to low pulley. Grasp cable stirrup with near arm. Position elbow against side with elbow bent approximately 90°.~Pull cable stirrup toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.~Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position throughout exercise. Exercise may be performed standing with medium high / adjustable pulley~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR4b0nyhq0FCc9SsynfGwxEIaZw1cHsxfWu7QKeCq_c87ykH-xnlisRVXscxT8&amp

676~23~Cable Standing Shoulder Internal Rotation~Cable~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Stand with side to elbow height cable pulley. Grasp cable stirrup with near arm. Position elbow against side with elbow bent approximately 90°.~Pull cable stirrup toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.~Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position throughout exercise. Exercise may be performed seated if medium high / adjustable pulley is not availble.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQa8viJTAZ2RlD6MYD7kKXmTQKdu-Z9roulal_pEFSiyjt_Vjmerk_Wn2h-SW8&amp

677~23~Dumbbell Supine Shoulder Internal Rotation (on bench with shoulder abducted)~Dumbbell~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lie supine on bench with dumbbell in one hand. Position dumbbell to side with elbow lateral to shoulder and arm bent 90° so wrist is above inside of elbow.~Maintaining 90° bend in elbow and its lateral position relative to shoulder. Lower dumbbell down to side of head until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell upwards above elbow by internally rotating shoulder until forearm returns to upright position. Repeat and continue with opposite arm.~Feet can be placed on ground for lateral stability or they can be placed on bench to place low back in more neurtal position. Maintain elbow&#39
column2: s near right angle bend and its position to side of shoulder throughout exercise.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTuxBs4ZnhCnEwGq4ohY9rZL9OJUSfYLV1I0CG7uA638bmNvuN10OJZYhVOlQ&amp

column1: 678~23~Dumbbell Shoulder Internal Rotation (on bench)~Dumbbell~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Hold dumbbell in one hand. Lie on bench close to edge on side with dumbbell in hand. Position elbow on edge of bench against side of body with elbow bent approximately 90°. Position legs on bench for support.~Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell away from body until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. Continue with opposite arm.~Maintain elbow&#39
column2: s bend and position at edge of bench against side of body throughout exercise. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRQ3kx83adRmPIUafVozQ-VOYINZ73OMxwrpaLHZzUlwgKYy2e7aFR2t_ui6Q&amp

column1: 679~23~Dumbbell Shoulder Internal Rotation (on floor)~Dumbbell~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Hold dumbbell in one hand. Lie on mat with dumbbell in hand. Position upper arm on mat close to body. Bend elbow approximately 90° with dumbbell held upright above elbow.~Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell toward floor until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is vertical and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.~Torso can lean back slightly allowing for fuller range of motion at the bottom of movement. In which case, forearm does not need to travel any closer than vertical toward body. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTuxBs4ZnhCnEwGq4ohY9rZL9OJUSfYLV1I0CG7uA638bmNvuN10OJZYhVOlQ&amp

680~23~Lever Shoulder Internal Rotation (plate loaded)~Lever (plate loaded)~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lie supine on section of bench furthest away from pads to each side. Position body so shoulders and elbows are aligned to fulcrum on each side. Place wrists or hands on under lower set of pads to each side of head.~Pull lever arms upward and toward each side of torso as far as possible by simultaneously rotating upper arms. Lower lever arms to original position and repeat.~Those with shorter forearms whose wrists do not make contact with pad would utilize Wrist Flexors as stabilizer to keep wrists ridged while hands move pads.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTIe6p8FvB3UElnZEHl7d66lidLK5A4C4nA6DmvhGdrnUfyRFke47bz0wptuQ&amp

681~23~Lever Shoulder Internal Rotation~Lever (selectorized)~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Place elbow on forearm pad and grasp handle with upper arm to side of body and forearm away from body.~Pull lever toward from body. Return and repeat. Adjust lever to opposite side and repeat with other arm.~Adjust lever and body orientation to achieve full range of motion.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTIe6p8FvB3UElnZEHl7d66lidLK5A4C4nA6DmvhGdrnUfyRFke47bz0wptuQ&amp

682~23~Lever Upright Shoulder Internal Rotation~Lever (selectorized)~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Primary lever should be positioned back with lever handle resting forward on elbow pad. Lift lever handle and sit on seat with arm pads and lever to side. Place elbow in elbow pads at shoulder height and grip handle with over hand grip so forearm is orientated upward and back. With opposite hand, grasp seat handle if available, for added stability.~Pull lever handle forward and downward as far as possible by rotating upper arm. Allow lever to return to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.~Turn seat facing inward at 45° if external rotation ROM of shoulder is limited. Consequently placing the upper arm in this plane limits internal rotation ROM of shoulder and Supraspinatus will assist slightly in interal rotation.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTIe6p8FvB3UElnZEHl7d66lidLK5A4C4nA6DmvhGdrnUfyRFke47bz0wptuQ&amp

683~23~Broom Stick Subscapularis Stretch~Stretch~~~~Grasp end of pole with one hand. Flip pole over upper arm. Position bent arm to side of body with other end of pole behind arm. Reach across body as far as possible with opposite arm and grasp lower end of pole. Position elbow at height of shoulder with pole positioned on back side of upper arm. ~Pull lower end of pole forward and upward so shoulder is externally rotated. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite arm.~Before pulling pole forward and upward, attempt to orientate pole as vertical as possible and elbow of upper arm as close to lateral of shoulder as possible.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTjrO6KiEM27fl9nxFzLRgA3ljc2gGUEOKC9SNejpOIoduU8W4YiYWMkiMPCg&amp

684~23~Doorway Subscapularis Stretch~Stretch~~~~~~Bent knees slightly so stretch is not limited by hamstring flexibility and to keep shoulder from being pushed forward.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTi2YZfePi4VZxbKqb1pXX_-rm4-jOdb2akp7ogakkgQzPYevGBZbdYgBgIoaE&amp
column2: s685~24~Machine-assisted Chest Dip~Assisted~Basic~Compound~Push~Mount wide dip bar with oblique grip (bar diagonal under palm), arms straight with shoulders above hands. Step down onto assistance lever with hips and knees bent.~Lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.~See mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to kneel on platform instead of standing on bar. Also see Assisted Triceps Dip.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcS58dXGdDxtpCwaWzqId4gDpaaVmCkrAl6Xyv6YFOeEty7myeJ-jiSgZl2UFg&amp

column1: 686~24~Machine-assisted Chest Dip (kneeling)~Assisted~Basic~Compound~Push~Mount wide dip bar with oblique grip (bar diagonal under palm), arms straight with shoulders above hands. Kneel on padded platform, lowering it down slightly so hips are slightly bent.~Lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.~See mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to standing on bar. Also see Assisted Triceps Dip.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcS6N4iTsO4Vs2_MKgMr-vklBi-QiAzBpdXIzhpk6EEdezEEttjQTYxZd2rIKw&amp

687~24~Barbell Bench Press~Barbell~Basic~Compound~Push~Lie supine on bench. Dismount barbell from rack over upper chest using wide oblique overhand grip.~Lower weight to chest. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.~Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT6Xe2YlWXsSdieBf33B8-0M8_EmvyUl9xB_u-NdW7p3RgXkMd0gBozgWiVMdI&amp

688~24~Barbell Bench Press (power lift)~Barbell~Basic~Compound~Push~Lie supine on bench. Grasp bar with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Arch back, extend hips, and position feet back flat on floor. Dismount barbell from rack over chest.~Lower weight to lower chest. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.~Competitive lifting requires bar to make contact with chest above bottom of the sternum with momentary pause. Gluteus Maximus, Erector Spinae, Quadriceps, and other muscles may be considered significant stabilizers during actual powerlift.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSNuUXikzIqfygngLQKRH9M-jknHGo1SVwNm4TBbbkA5x9FNuRRs6ulJHC4yw&amp

689~24~Barbell Board Press~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Lie supine on bench. Grasp bar with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Arch back, extend hips, and position feet back flat on floor. Dismount barbell from rack over chest. Have assistant hold board on center of chest.~Lower weight toward lower chest on   to board. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.~Instead of assistant holding bench board, it can be strapped to torso, as shown. Boards of varying thicknesses (1, 2, or 3) can be used. Board Press develops strength in middle range of motion for Bench Press. Gluteus Maximus, Erector Spinae, Quadriceps, and other muscles may be considered significant stabilizers during actual powerlift.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQkioy5fV8WhyxB15H0-tGlf89827vPtvnJbpZac3PTl-UsaFAbFxxt9JVhSw&amp

690~24~Barbell Floor Press~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Lie supine on floor at base of power rack. Place feet on floor with knees bent. Grasp bar from rack with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Dismount barbell from rack over chest.~Lower weight to lower chest until the triceps are completely on the floor. Relax momentarily, then press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.~Floor Presses are also said to build explosive strength by breaking eccentric/concentric chain (AKA: stretch-shortening cycle) normally activated at bottom of standard Bench Press.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRIb5CVk0Gkl40M-uPjIdwXeORSDk4PYSEridPmTiguWsiEvQei8qSK0pydUtE&amp

691~24~Barbell Guillotine Bench Press~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Lie supine on bench. Dismount barbell from rack over upper chest using wide oblique overhand grip.~Lower weight to neck to upper chest. Upper arms will be perpendicular to torso. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.~Upper arm travels in perpendicular path to torso to minimize anterior deltoid involvement and mimics upper arm positioning of Chest Flies. The oblique grip (hand positioned with palm diagonal on bar) allows elbows to be more easily turned outward to each side. Also see Bench Press Analysis.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQ0MkPXAxyVHmPzh0-M9_QpIuh00-0f07NWvZO9d3s4UcnnBICE0966w6-IzA&amp

692~24~Barbell Bench Press (with chains)~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Lie supine on bench. Grasp barbell loaded with thick chains from each side, with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Dismount barbell from rack over chest.~Lower weight to chest. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.~Chains provide increasing resistance as barbell moves away from floor. Chains can be used during either Powerlift-style Bench Press or Standard-style Bench Press. Also see Bench Press Analysis.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRxkQiZmq5OdRDXsxpvY-QnjZrPQhcwRBkSdOw2uqC8yVN66i-zCSiLwjy3aQ&amp

693~24~Barbell Decline Bench Press~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Lie supine on decline bench with feet under leg brace. Dismount barbell from rack over chest using wide oblique overhand grip.~Lower weight to chest. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.~Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Latissimus Dorsi involvement is l   ow on Decline Bench Press (Barnett 1995). Also see Bench Press Analysis.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRr6aHc2NJpLPT14_G3_6OiddOZ2K32BVPHrXBAbiQYDRHsV2IoAyj0Q93sMMA&amp

694~24~Cable Chest Dip~Cable~Basic~Compound~Push~Step between wide dip bars with dip belt around waist. Kneel as close as possible to low pulley and attach cable to dip belt. Stand up and mount dip bar with oblique grip (bar diagonal under palm), arms straight with shoulders above hands. Keep hips and knees bent.~Lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up until arms are straight and repeat.~The animation depicts dip bar placed in front of low pull cable. If cable dip machine is available, attach hip harness and step up to dip bar. Also see Cable Triceps Dip.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRumLoAGkJSIO35SYel2Lh-QfUDpu8UDwMYat3b09rgd_XKG6FCk5DKGhF8yA&amp

695~24~Cable Decline Fly~Cable~Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Grasp two opposing high pulley dumbbell attachments. Lie supine on decline bench, in middle and perpendicular to both pulleys. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.~Bring cable stirrups together above upper abdomen in hugging motion
column2: elbows in fixed position and shoulders internally rotated so elbows are to sides. Return to starting position until chest is slightly stretched. Repeat.~Since incline of bench does not actually affect angle of pull as with dumbbells, similar effect can be achieved on flat bench if cable stirrups are brought together above upper abdomen instead of chest.   Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent. Anterior Deltoid will no longer act as synergist in steep decline bench position.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT-0dXhfKmmtDOw38xi7OykoEvYH9uXLrlbY2ioR78puop5ac4G47-gLB9dBA&amp

column1: 696~24~Cable Lying Fly~Cable~Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Grasp two opposing low pulley stirrup attachments. Lie supine on bench, in middle and perpendicular to both pulleys. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.~Bring cable attachments together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position and shoulders internally rotated so elbows are to sides. Return to starting position until slight stretch. Repeat.~Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQU5An9uHAi9pgQYxLobidCsTm0NPaivRLEolWzH7jtlATkn0yDgCI5O6PCUg&amp

697~24~Cable Seated Fly~Cable~Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.~Keeping elbows pointed high, bring cable attachments together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position. Return to starting position until slight stretch. Repeat.~Shoulders are kept internally rotated so elbows are pointing back   and out to sides.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRDJ95pnfFesMj3w88XfKW-h4S8Z-6AbHTake5T_SfsZ-lTgDcahZMJ33cACw&amp

698~24~Cable Standing Fly~Cable~Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Grasp two opposing high pulley dumbbell attachments. Stand with pulleys to each side. Bend over slightly by flexing hips and knees. Bend elbows slightly and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back initially.~Bring cable attachments together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position. Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows are pointed upward at top and out to sides at bottom. Return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. Repeat.~Under greater resistance, positioning torso at lower angle downward (by bending over at hips), will allow upper body weight to counterbalance upward pull of cables, as opposed to stepping forward and struggling with   backward pull of cables.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQ1qVfmOTb0luPzvwFJrWIwgWKH539IXFzJ-4gGjME5PIwLPbMHrU6uYsc8ZRs&amp

699~24~Cable Bench Press~Cable~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Lie on bench and grasp stirrups attached to low cable pulley on each side. Position stirrups out to each side of chest with bent arm under each wrist.~Push stirrups up over each shoulder until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in shoulders or chest. Repeat.~Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at t   op. Also see Bench Press Analysis.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTcGnsmUnYvbJ7zMXSeXT59CiNwtfZrQmhRJOYTe8TY-QfQq8ZaKB5uavpT8oA&amp

700~24~Cable Bar Bench Press~Cable~Basic~Compound~Push~Position adjustable pulley higher than intended height but within arms reach from bench. Position bench under cable bar. Lie supine on bench. While lying on bench, reach over and lower each pulley into intended position so that cables are taut in lowest position with bar on chest. Grasp bar with both hands using wide oblique overhand grip.~Press bar upward until arms are extended. Lower bar to chest or until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. Repeat.~Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Bench Press Analysis and Cable Bar Standing Bench Press.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQaGsDkZcukxiSe-PlZjqMyRJ4vGbt48rKTtDSP6ezJ5d0aVranb_16qyNmy-0&amp

701~24~Cable Chest Press~Cable~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side. Position elbows out to sides, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hands slightly narrower than elbow width in front of upper arms.~Push stirrups out straight until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in shoulders or chest. Repeat.~Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, traveling inward in front of each shoulder at extended position.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSzYOxH1QFpLh_UGVN2Z1mlF-Dp-_YbSwfCIgvb2Q0wCReTum6J38TbaNiT8A&amp

702~24~Cable One Arm Chest Press~Cable~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Sit on seat and grasp stirrup to one side. Position elbows out to side, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hand slightly narrower than elbow width in front of upper arm.~Push stirrups out straight in front of shoulder until arm is straight. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt through shoulder or chest. Repeat.~Also see exercise performed with twisting movement. Pectoralis Minor and Serratus Anterior act as stabilizers if torso is not against back support as shown.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTJH3X1wuAz7FOwUmSMYklOw4keHqvk3wtmsFbTjbK4h1Vn9g6OUiPAySkQ5Es&amp

703~24~Cable Standing Chest Press~Cable~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Stand between two shoulder height pulleys, facing away from cable columns. Grasp cable stirrups from each side. Position stirrups to sides of chest with elbows out to sides. Position forearms horizontally and parallel with hands elbow width. Step forward in lunging posture (one foot in front and other foot behind). Lean and step forward with one foot in front, bending forward leg.~Push stirrups forward until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.~Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern as hands travel closer together toward extension. Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRb_WsX3Kc7CE1htSQ9FIbwTpH40fjV-dUWy7W0mBfzNxRHOaU5nZQuB5Ck8ZQ&amp

704~24~Cable Bar Standing Chest Press~Cable~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Stand facing behind cable bar, mounted on each side to shoulder height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip. Position bar chest height with elbows angled behind. Lean and step forward with one foot in front, bending forward leg.~Push cable bar forward until arms are straight. Return cable bar to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.~Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQ4OipJgcrRg6IStD225ULJHFDShaFX1Lye6vgQxKUhTqVNEqBGoSAs_wOJF4s&amp

705~24~Cable Twisting Chest Press~Cable~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Sit on seat and grasp stirrup to one side. Position elbow out to side, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hand slightly narrower than elbow width, in front of upper arm. Lean forward in seat.~Push stirrup out in front of upper chest while turning torso away from pulley. Return stirrup and torso back to original position allowing torso to rotate back until slight stretch is felt through chest, shoulder or waist. Repeat.~The effective range of motion of Pectoralis Major is only about half of what it is in non-twisting movement.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTEnnKfiMI5rE_XmAizK4mE2QsXNiSOFMGYrrn6rpcq9x3vAt6h7RCoViHqa7U&amp

706~24~Cable Decline Chest Press~Cable~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side. Position elbows out to sides, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hands slightly narrower than elbow width in front of upper arms.~Push stirrups forward and slightly downward until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in shoulders or chest. Repeat.~Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, traveling inward and slightly downward just below each shoulder at ex   tended position. Latissimus Dorsi involvement is low on Decline Bench Press (Barnett 1995).~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT-0dXhfKmmtDOw38xi7OykoEvYH9uXLrlbY2ioR78puop5ac4G47-gLB9dBA&amp

707~24~Cable Bar Standing Decline Chest Press~Cable~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Stand facing behind cable bar mounted on each side to shoulder height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip. Position bar   chest height with elbows angled behind and above. Lean and step forward with one foot in front, bending forward knee.~Push cable bar forward and downward until bar is about hip height and arms are straight. Return cable bar to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.~Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQ4OipJgcrRg6IStD225ULJHFDShaFX1Lye6vgQxKUhTqVNEqBGoSAs_wOJF4s&amp

708~24~Cable Standing Decline Chest Press~Cable~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Stand between two high pulleys, facing away from cable columns. Grasp cable stirrups from each side. Position stirrups down to sides of lower chest with elbows high out to sides. Angle forearms downward with hands elbow width or slightly narrower. Lean and step forward with forward leg bent or stand feet side by side with both legs slightly bent (as shown).~Push stirrups at forward/downward angle until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.~Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern as hands travel closer together toward extension. Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT-0dXhfKmmtDOw38xi7OykoEvYH9uXLrlbY2ioR78puop5ac4G47-gLB9dBA&amp

709~24~Cable Twisting Standing Chest Press~Cable~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Grasp cable stirrup from chest height pulley. Turn body away from pulley. Position elbow of loaded arm out to side, lower chest height. Position loaded hand back approximately shoulder height and elbow width. Step far forward with foot of opposite side of loaded arm. Bend knees and position heel off rear foot off floor.~Push stirrups away from body, horizontally until arm is straight and inline with cable. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.~Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, traveling inward in front shoulder at contracted position.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQtPz6SHgM57VOnpIzg1FpXNe0zoGUCY7e4zK7dMUXjOdoPFPB-ScThgWq0S6Q&amp

710~24~Cable Decline Fly~Flies~Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Grasp two opposing high pulley dumbbell attachments. Lie supine on decline bench, in middle and perpendicular to both pulleys. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.~Bring cable stirrups together above upper abdomen in hugging motion
column2: elbows in fixed position and shoulders internally rotated so elbows are to sides. Return to starting position until chest is slightly stretched. Repeat.~Since incline of bench does not actually affect angle of pull as with dumbbells, similar effect can be achieved on flat bench if cable stirrups are brought together above upper abdomen instead of chest.   Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent. Anterior Deltoid will no longer act as synergist in steep decline bench position.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT-0dXhfKmmtDOw38xi7OykoEvYH9uXLrlbY2ioR78puop5ac4G47-gLB9dBA&amp

column1: 711~24~Cable Lying Fly~Flies~Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Grasp two opposing low pulley stirrup attachments. Lie supine on bench, in middle and perpendicular to both pulleys. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.~Bring cable attachments together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position and shoulders internally rotated so elbows are to sides. Return to starting position until slight stretch. Repeat.~Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQU5An9uHAi9pgQYxLobidCsTm0NPaivRLEolWzH7jtlATkn0yDgCI5O6PCUg&amp

712~24~Cable Seated Fly~Flies~Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.~Keeping elbows pointed high, bring cable attachments together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position. Return to starting position until slight stretch. Repeat.~Shoulders are kept internally rotated so elbows are pointing back   and out to sides.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRDJ95pnfFesMj3w88XfKW-h4S8Z-6AbHTake5T_SfsZ-lTgDcahZMJ33cACw&amp

713~24~Cable Standing Fly~Flies~Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Grasp two opposing high pulley dumbbell attachments. Stand with pulleys to each side. Bend over slightly by flexing hips and knees. Bend elbows slightly and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back initially.~Bring cable attachments together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position. Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows are pointed upward at top and out to sides at bottom. Return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. Repeat.~Under greater resistance, positioning torso at lower angle downward (by bending over at hips), will allow upper body weight to counterbalance upward pull of cables, as opposed to stepping forward and struggling with   backward pull of cables.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQ1qVfmOTb0luPzvwFJrWIwgWKH539IXFzJ-4gGjME5PIwLPbMHrU6uYsc8ZRs&amp

714~24~Cable Bench Press~Presses~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Lie on bench and grasp stirrups attached to low cable pulley on each side. Position stirrups out to each side of chest with bent arm under each wrist.~Push stirrups up over each shoulder until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in shoulders or chest. Repeat.~Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at t   op. Also see Bench Press Analysis.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTcGnsmUnYvbJ7zMXSeXT59CiNwtfZrQmhRJOYTe8TY-QfQq8ZaKB5uavpT8oA&amp

715~24~Cable Bar Bench Press~Presses~Basic~Compound~Push~Position adjustable pulley higher than intended height but within arms reach from bench. Position bench under cable bar. Lie supine on bench. While lying on bench, reach over and lower each pulley into intended position so that cables are taut in lowest position with bar on chest. Grasp bar with both hands using wide oblique overhand grip.~Press bar upward until arms are extended. Lower bar to chest or until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. Repeat.~Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Bench Press Analysis and Cable Bar Standing Bench Press.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQaGsDkZcukxiSe-PlZjqMyRJ4vGbt48rKTtDSP6ezJ5d0aVranb_16qyNmy-0&amp

716~24~Cable Chest Press~Presses~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side. Position elbows out to sides, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hands slightly narrower than elbow width in front of upper arms.~Push stirrups out straight until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in shoulders or chest. Repeat.~Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, traveling inward in front of each shoulder at extended position.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSzYOxH1QFpLh_UGVN2Z1mlF-Dp-_YbSwfCIgvb2Q0wCReTum6J38TbaNiT8A&amp

717~24~Cable One Arm Chest Press~Presses~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Sit on seat and grasp stirrup to one side. Position elbows out to side, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hand slightly narrower than elbow width in front of upper arm.~Push stirrups out straight in front of shoulder until arm is straight. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt through shoulder or chest. Repeat.~Also see exercise performed with twisting movement. Pectoralis Minor and Serratus Anterior act as stabilizers if torso is not against back support as shown.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTJH3X1wuAz7FOwUmSMYklOw4keHqvk3wtmsFbTjbK4h1Vn9g6OUiPAySkQ5Es&amp

718~24~Cable Standing Chest Press~Presses~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Stand between two shoulder height pulleys, facing away from cable columns. Grasp cable stirrups from each side. Position stirrups to sides of chest with elbows out to sides. Position forearms horizontally and parallel with hands elbow width. Step forward in lunging posture (one foot in front and other foot behind). Lean and step forward with one foot in front, bending forward leg.~Push stirrups forward until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.~Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern as hands travel closer together toward extension. Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRb_WsX3Kc7CE1htSQ9FIbwTpH40fjV-dUWy7W0mBfzNxRHOaU5nZQuB5Ck8ZQ&amp

719~24~Cable Bar Standing Chest Press~Presses~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Stand facing behind cable bar, mounted on each side to shoulder height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip. Position bar chest height with elbows angled behind. Lean and step forward with one foot in front, bending forward leg.~Push cable bar forward until arms are straight. Return cable bar to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.~Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQ4OipJgcrRg6IStD225ULJHFDShaFX1Lye6vgQxKUhTqVNEqBGoSAs_wOJF4s&amp

720~24~Cable Twisting Chest Press~Presses~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Sit on seat and grasp stirrup to one side. Position elbow out to side, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hand slightly narrower than elbow width, in front of upper arm. Lean forward in seat.~Push stirrup out in front of upper chest while turning torso away from pulley. Return stirrup and torso back to original position allowing torso to rotate back until slight stretch is felt through chest, shoulder or waist. Repeat.~The effective range of motion of Pectoralis Major is only about half of what it is in non-twisting movement.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTEnnKfiMI5rE_XmAizK4mE2QsXNiSOFMGYrrn6rpcq9x3vAt6h7RCoViHqa7U&amp

721~24~Cable Decline Chest Press~Presses~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side. Position elbows out to sides, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hands slightly narrower than elbow width in front of upper arms.~Push stirrups forward and slightly downward until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in shoulders or chest. Repeat.~Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, traveling inward and slightly downward just below each shoulder at ex   tended position. Latissimus Dorsi involvement is low on Decline Bench Press (Barnett 1995).~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT-0dXhfKmmtDOw38xi7OykoEvYH9uXLrlbY2ioR78puop5ac4G47-gLB9dBA&amp

722~24~Cable Bar Standing Decline Chest Press~Presses~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Stand facing behind cable bar mounted on each side to shoulder height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip. Position bar   chest height with elbows angled behind and above. Lean and step forward with one foot in front, bending forward knee.~Push cable bar forward and downward until bar is about hip height and arms are straight. Return cable bar to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.~Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQ4OipJgcrRg6IStD225ULJHFDShaFX1Lye6vgQxKUhTqVNEqBGoSAs_wOJF4s&amp

723~24~Cable Standing Decline Chest Press~Presses~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Stand between two high pulleys, facing away from cable columns. Grasp cable stirrups from each side. Position stirrups down to sides of lower chest with elbows high out to sides. Angle forearms downward with hands elbow width or slightly narrower. Lean and step forward with forward leg bent or stand feet side by side with both legs slightly bent (as shown).~Push stirrups at forward/downward angle until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.~Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern as hands travel closer together toward extension. Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT-0dXhfKmmtDOw38xi7OykoEvYH9uXLrlbY2ioR78puop5ac4G47-gLB9dBA&amp

724~24~Cable Twisting Standing Chest Press~Presses~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Grasp cable stirrup from chest height pulley. Turn body away from pulley. Position elbow of loaded arm out to side, lower chest height. Position loaded hand back approximately shoulder height and elbow width. Step far forward with foot of opposite side of loaded arm. Bend knees and position heel off rear foot off floor.~Push stirrups away from body, horizontally until arm is straight and inline with cable. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.~Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, traveling inward in front shoulder at contracted position.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQtPz6SHgM57VOnpIzg1FpXNe0zoGUCY7e4zK7dMUXjOdoPFPB-ScThgWq0S6Q&amp

725~24~Dumbbell Bench Press~Dumbbell~Basic~Compound~Push~Sit down on bench with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick weights to shoulder and lie back. Position dumbbells to sides of chest with bent arm under each dumbbell.~Press dumbbells up with elbows to sides until arms are extended. Lower weight to sides of chest until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.~Dumbbells should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at top. No need to drop weights - see suggested mount and dismount techniques: standard or advanced. Also see mount &amp
