Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Although articulation of waist is emphasized, some hip extension may accommodate movement. Also see Barbell Hyperextension and Barbell Back Raise.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTm-YngJj_st5din8JeCTneAiuFMjXBgPeaZA3nnBSXIfI9ut-CWNVbYYUpuQ&amp

column1: 1505~33~Barbell Bent Knee Good-morning~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.~Bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.~Target muscle is exercised   isometrically  . Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep back straight. Knees will have to bend more in those with less hamstring flexibility. Knees can be kept bent throughout movement. Also see straight leg Goodmorning, emphasizing Hamstrings.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQoHMUPNiECnCC_t-p_6X4-ltNLgFwmhRs6KAqhi1DOBPD1-r7KuUscxuG3Uw&amp

1506~33~Barbell Deadlift~Barbell~Basic~Compound~Pull~With feet flat beneath bar, squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.~Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.~Target muscle is exercised isometrically. Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical lev   erage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip. Lever barbell jack can be used to lift barbell from floor for easier loading and unload of weight plates.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSolDniAQIvC5RjkVAKkGZV_aQILRdXxOr9R1zrnFXjhec6qIsJwAt0CQog5A&amp

1507~33~Barbell Block Pull~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~With barbell on blocks, position feet shoulder width or slightly narrower beneath bar. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.~Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.~Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQLrKme7L18wOHir4hwFXnNbISUe59CAUJSHsRVpA11iVklgSa-bgL_B76CjOs&amp

1508~33~Barbell Deficit Deadlift~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Stand on weight plate, bumper plate, or shallow elevated platform with loaded bar above feet. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.~Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weights to floor by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.~Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip. Lever barbell jack can be used to lift barbell from floor for easier loading and unloading of weight plates.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSuMW3tGF6etc3mEdDme-wAvxIpF3jGdXZIPt2kmpo4w6daSf7b81drXCsu0w&amp

1509~33~Barbell Rack Pull~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~In power rack, with barbell on safety bar in low position, place feet shoulder width or slightly narrower beneath bar. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.~Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.~Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip. Barbell Rack Pull emphasizes mid portion of Deadlift and allows more weight to be used while sparing leg involvement. Measuring bottom of plates from ground: 2&#34

1510~33~Barbell Sumo Deadlift~Barbell~Basic~Compound~Pull~Position feet under bar with very wide stance. Squat down and grasp bar between legs with shoulder width mixed grip. Face forward while positioning shoulders upward with arms straight, chest high, hips low, and back straight.~Pull bar up by driving feet outward while pulling chest up. Extend knees when bar passes knees. At top of lift, when torso is upright, drive shoulders back and chest up. Return weight to floor by bending hips back and knees pointed outward, while keeping chest high and back straight. Repeat.~Target muscle is exercised isometrically. Heavy barbell deadlifts significantly engages Latissmus Dorsi.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSUJ5MCadTDrx3gBADPTfXIx9yoxYOHR1m77mPDmti5DsNG814IiYK62ZXu8a4&amp

1511~33~Barbell Sumo Block Pull~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~With barbell on blocks, position feet under bar with very wide stance. Squat down and grasp bar between legs with shoulder width mixed grip. Face forward while positioning shoulders upward with arms straight, chest high, hips low, and back straight.~Pull bar up by driving feet outward while pulling chest up. Extend knees when bar passes knees. At top of lift, when torso is upright, drive shoulders back and chest up. Return weight to blocks by bending hips back and knees pointed outward, while keeping chest high and back straight. Repeat.~Use shoulder width grip since narrower than shoulder width grip will make it more difficult to lockout at top. Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight, and knees pointed out same direction as feet. Also, keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. With wide stance, push feet out to sides and not down to prevent knees from buckling inward. Pushing knees out will allow hips to travel toward bar more quickly while improving leverage. Barbell Sumo Block Pull emphasizes mid portion of Sumo Deadlift and allows more weight to be used while sparing leg involvement. 2&#34

1512~33~Barbell Stiff Leg Deadlift~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on shallow platform with feet flat beneath bar. Bend knees and bend over with lower back straight. Grasp barbell with shoulder width overhand or mixed grip, shoulder width or slightly wider. Lift weight to standing position.~Lower bar to top of feet by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing only slightly at bottom. With knees bent, lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.~Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion. Erector Spinae is exercised isometrically if low back does articulate as with Straight Back Stiff Leg Deadlift (targeting Glutes). Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate adaptation. Throughout lift keep arms straight. Knee can be kept bent throughout movement. Keep bar over top of feet, close to legs. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT4H0fv0bjnBDRG7TVj6hHWtmKwGRcqfoZZGm3H2ueNF4XiREr4xS3UopqoM2g&amp

1513~33~Barbell Straight Leg Deadlift~Barbell~Basic~Compound~Pull~Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on shallow platform with feet flat beneath bar. Bend knees and bend over with lower back straight. Grasp barbell with shoulder width overhand or mixed grip, shoulder width or slightly wider. Lift weight to standing position.~With knees straight, lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips and waist. Lift bar by extending waist and hip until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.~Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Throughout lift keep arms and knees straight. Keep bar over top of feet, close to legs. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTVtiYUBvtDK0lZf-DV6SbNTH5TGee-eS7kd2j_SLozEuvACOeYhxsKmze04kc&amp

1514~33~Trap Bar Deadlift~Barbell~~~~~~Target muscle is exercised isometrically. Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR4CqqOqX4Om_xLBfCpVDBDo8g_z_jBJGueDwLqkEVzpdG9VwzlaM6sjXbgUg&amp

1515~33~Trap Bar Stiff Leg Deadlift~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Stand on platform under loaded trap bar. Squat down and grasp handles to sides. Squat / Deadlift bar up to standing position.~Lower bar by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing only slightly at bottom. With knees bent, lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.~Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion. Erector Spinae is exercised isometrically   if low back does articulate as with Straight Back Stiff Leg Deadlift (targeting Glutes). Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep arms straight. Knee can be kept bent throughout movement. Keep bar over top of feet, close to legs.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT54s1AnHUCLvmF0qlIbv29FxvE2RYZPOMMy-eCdiLHly_r2Eaf0jdGMOB-Eq0&amp

1516~33~Trap Bar Straight Leg Deadlift~Barbell~Basic~Compound~Pull~Stand on platform under loaded trap bar. Squat down and grasp handles to sides. Squat / Deadlift bar up to standing position.~With knees straight, lower bar down by bending hips. After hips can no longer flex, bend waist as weights approach floor. Hands should be lowered near sides of ankles. Set weight on floor. Lift bar by extending waist and hip until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.~Not all trap bar designs may allow for this movement. A squared open-ended trap bar is used in this demonstration. Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep arms and knees straight.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT54s1AnHUCLvmF0qlIbv29FxvE2RYZPOMMy-eCdiLHly_r2Eaf0jdGMOB-Eq0&amp

1517~33~Cable Stiff Leg Deadlift~Cable~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.~Bow forward by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing low back at bottom. With knees slightly bent, raise torso by extending at waist, then hips, gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.~Lower back may bend slightly during hip flexion phase. Erector Spinae is exercised isometrically if low back does articulate as with Straight Back Stiff Leg Deadlift (targeting Glutes). Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep arms straight. Knee can be kept bent throughout movement. Do not stand behind pulleys.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSs5DCyCf6Zmu7zMVPAUcJKKXOroqWeugT6tfasVHJvs70bCZ5wJflmKLbISA&amp

1518~33~Cable Straight Leg Deadlift~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.~With knees straight, bow forward by bending hips. Bend waist as stirrups approach lowest position. Lift dumbbells by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.~Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep arms and knees straight. Do not stand behind pulleys. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion phase. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on flexibility. See Dangerous Exercise Essay. Also see Straight Back Straight Leg Deadlift.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSs5DCyCf6Zmu7zMVPAUcJKKXOroqWeugT6tfasVHJvs70bCZ5wJflmKLbISA&amp

1519~33~Dumbbell Straight Leg Deadlift~Dumbbell~Basic~Compound~Pull~Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance. Grasp dumbbells to sides.~With knees straight, lower dumbbells to top or sides of feet by bending hips. Allow hips to fall back and bend waist as dumbbell approaches feet. Lift dumbbells by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back if rounded. Repeat.~Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Throughout lift keep arms and knees straight. Keep dumbbells close to legs. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion phase. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on flexibility. See Dangerous Exercise Essay.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSJxeClJJ0ZNsyr1yNpexZXbUL9Hhgop5L03pjlEoxg8imjQoM9SGv-GwSRrRo&amp

1520~33~Dumbbell One Arm Straight Leg Deadlift~Dumbbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Stand with shoulder width or wide stance. Grasp dumbbell to side. Place opposite hand to side or behind low back.~With knees straight, lower dumbbell between feet by bending hips and twisting waist, so shoulder of weighted side is turned forward. Allow hips to fall back and waist to bend as dumbbell approaches floor. Lift dumbbell upward and back to side by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulder back if rounded. Repeat. Perform exercise with opposite arm.~Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep weighted arm and knees straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift or jerk weight from floor. Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion or it can be kept straight. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full rang   e of motion will vary from person to person depending on flexibility. See Dangerous Exercise Essay and Kettlebell Straight-leg Deadlift.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQw1juE-kd5f_L8cfogCtsslp-1rq0IQVZPQ_MDrjUplA3vqYi1tute2VH1Tw&amp

1521~33~Lever Deadlift (plate loaded)~Lever (plate loaded)~Basic~Compound~Pull~Stand in between lever handles. Squat down with feet flat and grasp handles to sides.~Lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.~Target muscle is exercised isometrically. Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Exercise can also be performed facing opposite direction toward fulcrum.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT_W0upbQZh5i5XvltI45EJ-9igsCy955kRT5xjTxRMmwYv79m7Rp3l7Qy3rgs&amp

1522~33~Lever Stiff Leg Deadlift (plate loaded)~Lever (plate loaded)~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.~Bow forward by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing low back at bottom. With knees slightly bent, raise torso by extending at waist, then hips, gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.~Lower back may bend slightly during hip flexion phase. Erector Spinae is exercised isometrically if low back does articulate as with Straight Back Stiff Leg Deadlift (targeting Glutes). Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate adaptation.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQZpOFnNXzu6xRGtDGXm8BiIxmttD3qxvrur4_bARd03ZJRcc-5cYDVxYi9Nwc&amp

1523~33~Lever Straight Leg Deadlift (plate loaded)~Lever (plate loaded)~Basic~Compound~Pull~Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.~With knees straight, bow forward by bending hips. Bend waist as stirrups approach lowest position. Lift lever by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.~Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep arms and knees straight. Do not stand behind pulleys. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion phase. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on flexibility. See Dangerous Exercise Essay. Also see Straight Back Straight Leg Deadlift.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQZpOFnNXzu6xRGtDGXm8BiIxmttD3qxvrur4_bARd03ZJRcc-5cYDVxYi9Nwc&amp

1524~33~Lever Back Extension~Lever (selectorized)~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Sit on machine with back against padded lever. Push hips back against back of seat by pushing feet against platform. Arch back in &#34
column3: shape.~Extend spine until hyperextended. Return and repeat.~To avoid hip movement, push hips back into seat by pushing feet into platform throughout exercise. Position foot platform, so small space remains between edge of seat and back of lower thigh. Use seat belt if it becomes difficult to stabilize hips. See Low Back Debate. Also see exercises on old Nautilus Machine and MedEx Low Back Machine.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT7lke7_rq-RifVCvPeTMw-qpc3_EIt4eKWTTGED9zy0blWf-byfvKHzFvnLX0&amp

column1: 1525~33~Lever Back Extension~Lever (selectorized)~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Sit in machine with feet on platform, back under padded lever, and hips against back of seat.~Extend lower hips and low back until extended. Return and repeat.~Those with limited hip flexor flexibility may need to stop before full extension on this particular type of apparatus (fulcrum near hip). Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Many machines may not sufficiently stabilize hips or their fulcrum may be near hip&#39
column2: s axis. In which case, synergists muscles become primary movers and erector spinae becomes stabilizer (Graves JE, et. al. 1994). See alternative back extension machines (Nautilus and MedX) with hip stabilization.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT7lke7_rq-RifVCvPeTMw-qpc3_EIt4eKWTTGED9zy0blWf-byfvKHzFvnLX0&amp

column1: 1526~33~Lever Back Extension~Lever (selectorized)~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Sit on seat and secure seat belt. Place feet on foot platform with knees bent approximately 135°. Position leg braces securely on legs. Release lever and grasp handles to each side. Lean completely forward and position back pad against back.~Extend spine until hyperextended. Return and repeat.~Exercise is performed on MedEx isolated lumbar spine apparatus. See Low Back Debate.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT7lke7_rq-RifVCvPeTMw-qpc3_EIt4eKWTTGED9zy0blWf-byfvKHzFvnLX0&amp

1527~33~Lever Kneeling Back Extension~Lever (selectorized)~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Slide back under lever pad and kneel on lower pad. Grasp handles and position feet on foot bars. Make sure knees are against knee pad and hips are against upper thigh pad.~Extend spine until hyperextended. Return and repeat.~Apparatus shown does not allow for full spinal flexion, only allowing for last half of spinal extension.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcThJ6cDD1a3S8jMh6Qc1qNyi-SuUckmGTgKvT59AgeKC_IxMFXyQ6c3pzxFvhU&amp

1528~33~Lever Pull Back Extension~Lever (selectorized)~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Sit on machine positioning back of hips against back pad and feet against foot bar with knees bent slightly. Push hips back against back of seat by pushing feet against foot bar. Reach forward and grasp handles with both hands.~Pull lever back until spine hyperextends while keeping hips pushed back against pad. Return and repeat.~To avoid hip movement, push hips back into seat by pushing feet into foot bar throughout exercise. Apparatus should be adjusted so knees remain slightly bent when hips are pushed back. See Low Back Debate.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSHTqtcsSaE0hfPGRGiqpkySnFq5ZPyiCadX2pBhwVFd87prcoqkSSig2EX1w&amp

1529~33~Smith Bent Knee Good-morning~Smith~Basic or Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Position bar on back of shoulders. Grasp bar to sides. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.~Bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.~Target muscle is exercised isometrically   . Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep back straight. Knees will have to bend more with those with less hamstring flexibility. Knees can be kept bent throughout movement. Also see straight leg Goodmorning emphasizing Hamstrings.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRFcyn1y3lh9GrDfGYfANn645ASD00F4aq1AhzhZMZMOSEuEFkIRCNBP-UtMOE&amp

1530~33~Smith Deadlift~Smith~Basic~Compound~Pull~Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance with feet flat beneath bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider mixed grip or slightly wider. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.~Squat down to lower bar by bending hips and knees. Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.~Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. See Smith Deadlift under Gluteus Maximus. Also see Deadlift Analysis.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTgrAzPF_4tHXrezclS6D-8yLWCWfk1_Dios92cqnA-2mn4RJssQ0GDQP8pLw&amp

1531~33~Smith Stiff Leg Deadlift~Smith~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on elevated platform with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.~With knees slightly bent, Lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips. Keep waist straight, flexing only slightly at bottom. Lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.~Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion. Erector Spinae is exercised isometrically   if low back does articulate as with Straight Back Stiff Leg Deadlift (targeting Glutes). Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep arms straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR5AGEjp1rODgYLDewamHkwXbzNXAZLlgT4c6_AjDKZ-IB26DGWKSdmxBVsKw&amp

1532~33~Smith Straight Leg Deadlift~Smith~Basic~Compound~Pull~Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on elevated platform with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.~With knees straight, lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips. After hips can no longer flex, bend waist as bar approaches top of feet. Lift bar by extending waist and hip until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.~Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep arms and knees straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Those with less flexibility may not even need to stand on platform. See Dangerous Exercise Essay. Also see Stiff Leg Deadlift.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR5AGEjp1rODgYLDewamHkwXbzNXAZLlgT4c6_AjDKZ-IB26DGWKSdmxBVsKw&amp

1533~33~Weighted Hyperextension~Weighted~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.~If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers:~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT3kpM903msr7Qrjn6ABlaLsKC0wkpR9MMl3xpkPyd_M9M7EXsYQUkBeirfRF0&amp

1534~33~Weighted Back Extension (on hyperextension apparatus)~Weighted~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.~Lower body by bending waist until fully flexed. Raise, or extend waist until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.~Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT9NwqaR34-6My59q9f8hbvJK17Lfq9KKoXe-P1iIeIxCtAZ5Zfp7rBPam4lXo&amp

1535~33~Weighted Back Extension (on stability ball)~Weighted~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lie prone on ball. Position toes out wide on floor for balance. Hold weight under chin or behind neck.~Raise torso off of ball by hyperextending spine. Lower torso onto ball allowing spine to flex. Repeat.~Movement can be made easier by using no additional weight or by positioning hips low on ball. In contrast, exercise can be made more challenging by positioning ball lower toward hip. In which case, feet may be placed against base of wall for stability. See Arm Position During Waist Exercises. If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQKyJkdMRxtGQUizu3207n_OArKMoWkYFftUGoFUXQOWM6jQol0Susbzxhxm9g&amp

1536~33~Weighted 45° Hyperextension~Weighted~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.~If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers:~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTEC0StU6kPoKkL6czGl5cJWN2bi64Mg-Cnw88rHsewxg57QHkNWUw0S_IxCZY&amp

1537~33~Weighted 45° Back Extension (on hyperextension apparatus)~Weighted~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.~Lower body by bending waist until fully flexed. Raise, or extend waist until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.~Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited
column2: abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTowfvQ056Nrah_-JHxlyeERJBnt1GHP7DVb9s7q971hCOcLyHDZ95Lc3R0Vg&amp

column1: 1538~33~Cable Stiff Leg Deadlift~Cable~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.~Bow forward by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing low back at bottom. With knees slightly bent, raise torso by extending at waist, then hips, gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.~Lower back may bend slightly during hip flexion phase. Erector Spinae is exercised isometrically if low back does articulate as with Straight Back Stiff Leg Deadlift (targeting Glutes). Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep arms straight. Knee can be kept bent throughout movement. Do not stand behind pulleys.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSs5DCyCf6Zmu7zMVPAUcJKKXOroqWeugT6tfasVHJvs70bCZ5wJflmKLbISA&amp

1539~33~Cable Straight Leg Deadlift~Cable~Basic~Compound~Pull~Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.~With knees straight, bow forward by bending hips. Bend waist as stirrups approach lowest position. Lift dumbbells by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.~Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep arms and knees straight. Do not stand behind pulleys. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion phase. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on flexibility. See Dangerous Exercise Essay. Also see Straight Back Straight Leg Deadlift.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSs5DCyCf6Zmu7zMVPAUcJKKXOroqWeugT6tfasVHJvs70bCZ5wJflmKLbISA&amp

1540~33~Back Extension (on stability ball, arms down)~Bodyweight~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lie prone on ball with feet against base of wall. Place arms to sides or clasp hands behind hips or low back.~Raise torso off of ball by hyperextending spine. Lower torso onto ball allowing spine to flex. Repeat.~If no wall is available, hips can be positioned lower on ball and toes can be positioned out wide on floor for balance. Synergists only work partial range of motion through terminal extension.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQKyJkdMRxtGQUizu3207n_OArKMoWkYFftUGoFUXQOWM6jQol0Susbzxhxm9g&amp

1541~33~Back Extension (on stability ball, arms crossed)~Bodyweight~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lie prone on ball, with front of feet apart on floor or with feet against base of wall. Cross arms, hands in front of shoulders.~Raise torso off of ball by hyperextending spine. Lower torso onto ball allowing spine to flex. Repeat.~If no wall is available, hips can be positioned lower on ball and toes can be positioned out wide on floor for balance.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTVoG-rPuLTdeiYDEHA-R03jtaol1hEPjdP6iiBv7XCPrR3dD_qBS7L4v_enic&amp

1542~33~Back Extension (on stability ball, arms up)~Bodyweight~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lie prone on ball with feet against base of wall. Place arms parallel out over floor beyond head.~Raise torso off of ball and hands over head by hyperextending spine. Lower torso onto ball allowing spine to flex with arms being lowered toward floor. Repeat.~If no wall is available, hips can be positioned lower on ball and toes can be positioned out wide on floor for balance. Synergists only work partial range of motion through terminal extension.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQk9E5c__pRb5fUl31p_rKaOS7leM__h_2MgTdbRZ21_ktfc_j3Eeo9rJk8CA&amp

1543~33~Bird Dog~Bodyweight~~~~~~Lift leg and arm deliberately with no jerking. Also see Alternating Bird Dog.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSb1HItCO8jHmubXx3P99yiOCFq1HtGZG1Y2S-aZVO44qv_HsZ7ffVKviQ4oA&amp

1544~33~Alternating Bird Dog~Bodyweight~~~~~~Lift legs and arms deliberately with no jerking. Also see Bird Dog.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRMv2ygUmJJoihO81YAwGX3QfvbovfOl6PmBivTXYP_wmSXxVCH7F1pdRQ9bdE&amp

1545~33~Bird Dog (on stability ball)~Bodyweight~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lay on top of exercise ball with legs and hands slightly apart. Place chest down so torso is wrapped over ball.~Raise arm and torso upward beside head while raising leg on opposite side up out behind body. Lower arm, torso, and leg to original position and repeat. Perform movement with opposite arm and leg.~Lift leg and arm deliberately with no jerking. Also see Alternating Bird Dog (one exercise ball).~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSz1p5lVhRhnIvR5sIZ4wiNA7B1wSbQx8wedFrMDmSoiMyVV8GMhoCJxinmWA&amp

1546~33~Alternating Bird Dog (on exercise ball)~Bodyweight~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Lay on top of exercise ball with legs and hands slightly apart. Place chest down so torso is wrapped over ball.~Raise left arm and torso upward beside head while raising right leg up behind body. Lower arm, torso, and leg to original position and repeat. Repeat by raising and lowering right arm and left leg in same manner. Repeat by alternating between opposite sides.~Lift leg and arm deliberately with no jerking. Also see Bird Dog (on exercise ball).~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSz1p5lVhRhnIvR5sIZ4wiNA7B1wSbQx8wedFrMDmSoiMyVV8GMhoCJxinmWA&amp

1547~33~Hanging Hyperextension~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Stand behind bar facing elevated platform positioned slightly away on other side of bar. Grasp bar with slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Walk body under bar and position back of heels on elevated platform. With legs extended forward, hang under bar with arms straight and hips bent just above floor.~Raise hips up as high as possible by extending hips and spine. Lower hips to original position just above floor. Repeat.~Platform should be high enough to allow hips to flex without buttocks contacting floor. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Adductor Magnus may only assist at initial phase hip extension depending on degree of hip flexion at bottom of movement. Also see Hanging Hamstring Bridge for Hamstrings.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRRWSlXexh9PUrbAdkhNlCXwgGr9SmJ5sjkZhwtRupId-yneMBnL2EPtphUsQ&amp

1548~33~Hyperextension (hands behind hips)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Clasp hands behind hips or low back.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.~Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad and full range of motion is permitted
column2: abdomen should not press on side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTTDWWv7xrJX_pJXnr4NrPzzT5rvdlCUPtF_Ah9H3SQgkZ9AX7NGf4nzvgnmjo&amp

column1: 1549~33~Hyperextension (arms crossed)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Cross arms on chest.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.~Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad and full range of motion is permitted
column2: abdomen should not press on side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRBNMXq-dB3VDCM8hF5qjXtxafmKekaxYfAi4jl8IUVm7Mm1R2nk4bKr2QCdIU&amp

column1: 1550~33~Hyperextension (hands on head)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Place hands behind neck or to sides of head.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.~Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad and full range of motion is permitted
column2: abdomen should not press on side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR3AgUkTG8P65D7fkZH6egArtP1F87kH9ZUL38yutIkPCUbGiKWmGDshjRxz68&amp

column1: 1551~33~45° Hyperextension (hands behind hips)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Clasp hands behind hips or low back.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.~~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTTDWWv7xrJX_pJXnr4NrPzzT5rvdlCUPtF_Ah9H3SQgkZ9AX7NGf4nzvgnmjo&amp

1552~33~45° Hyperextension (arms crossed)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Cross arms across chest.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.~Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited
column2: abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTBqedtU4hUkyJQcsImiZWLyKYCEzaBhMOEvPuQzDS_skCdAlRbMYhvyagBiw&amp

column1: 1553~33~45° Hyperextension (hands behind neck)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace.  Place hands behind neck or to sides of head.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.~Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad and full range of motion is permitted
column2: abdomen should not press on side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. column1: 1554~33~45° Hyperextension (arms up)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace.  Place arms parallel extending upward to sides of head.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.~~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQMFMHDajpmYAtkbIwfAIR0KJQ5SmDwgUH1VuOISjKwtgIQYRFeoMTplZ0evw&amp

1555~33~45° Hyperextension (across bench, hands behind hips)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Position padded flat bench parallel to wall or fence with lower overhang or rail. Place wedge padding or towels folded and stacked forming slope on bench. Lean over bench and place forefeet on ground with heels hooked under lower overhang or rail. Position thighs prone on sloped padding. Clasp hands behind hips or low back.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.~~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTyWu4GwofwOBOLu0z2Jr-k-EtBQ9oUSik_N6I-2jp76r-cEP4IvVoCEX8crA&amp

1556~33~45° Hyperextension (across bench, arms crossed)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Position padded flat bench parallel to wall or fence with lower overhang or rail. Place wedge padding or towels folded and stacked forming slope on bench. Lean over bench and place forefeet on ground with heels hooked under lower overhang or rail. Position thighs prone on sloped padding. Cross arms on chest.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.~Position bench and padding so thigh support is high enough to comfortably support body weight but not so high that range of motion is limited in lower position. Range of motion may tend to be more slightly more restricted across bench as opposed to performing on 45º hyperextension apparatus. However, lower to mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back if possible. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTyWu4GwofwOBOLu0z2Jr-k-EtBQ9oUSik_N6I-2jp76r-cEP4IvVoCEX8crA&amp

Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.~Position bench and padding so thigh support is high enough to comfortably support body weight but not so high that range of motion is limited in lower position. Range of motion may tend to be more slightly more restricted across bench as opposed to performing on 45º hyperextension apparatus. However, lower to mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back if possible. 1558~33~45° Hyperextension (across bench, arms up)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Position padded flat bench parallel to wall or fence with lower overhang or rail. Place wedge padding or towels folded and stacked forming slope on bench. Lean over bench and place forefeet on ground with heels hooked under lower overhang or rail. Position thighs prone on sloped padding. Place arms parallel extending upward to sides of head.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.~~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQ97uNLVy1SZUl3bGFF0mrHw0AM1wUl5Li8Cd_k_jn2xdUiUwplIJsws23s7ww&amp

1559~33~45° Hyperextension (on stability ball, hands behind hips)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Place exercise ball near wall or fence with lower overhang or rail. Position thighs prone on ball with forefeet on ground and heels hooked under lower overhang or rail. Clasp hands behind hips or low back.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist as low as possible or until mild stretch is felt. Repeat.~~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRR6X2tPT_cVahnYv7pKsxt-hJmnEDkIQXC-QICwLPthU7PW_wwsaOkgYIIDfg&amp

1560~33~45° Hyperextension (on stability ball, arms crossed)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Place exercise ball near wall or fence with lower overhang or rail. Position thighs prone on ball with forefeet on ground and heels hooked under lower overhang or rail. Cross arms on chest.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist as low as possible or until mild stretch is felt. Repeat.~Choose ball size and positioning to provide adequate thigh support to comfortably support body weight yet allows for full range of motion in lower position. Range of motion may tend to be more restricted on ball as opposed to performing on 45º hyperextension apparatus. However, lower to mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back if possible.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT5TyzoKRkjboOivwvD4h733ekVQv7X0oxwi-Jm-RE3wjuGWEPYTNcyju6wRQ&amp

1561~33~45° Hyperextension (on stability ball, hands behind neck)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Place exercise ball near wall or fence with lower overhang or rail. Repeat.~Choose ball size and positioning to provide adequate thigh support to comfortably support body weight yet allows for full range of motion in lower position. Range of motion may tend to be more restricted on ball as opposed to performing on 45º hyperextension apparatus. However, lower to mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back if possible.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRZG6VHUm4_N4lKzdRzukVVm3ZcPrtr4hvdlvX6TGvwX2rTzClRhq6ulXT8X5c&amp

1562~33~45° Hyperextension (on stability ball, arms up)~Bodyweight~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Place exercise ball near wall or fence with lower overhang or rail. Position thighs prone on ball with forefeet on ground and heels hooked under lower overhang or rail. Place arms parallel extending upward to sides of head.~Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist if possible, pulling in upper arms to continue lowering upper body as low as possible or until mild stretch is felt. Repeat.~~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSyt3ZIG5YzBNKVOTxccDbFvSwO6fVytM1NRmsaf0kasNqxJu6YOiNRwAP4Vw&amp

1563~33~Suspended Hyperextension~Suspended~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Fold at hips onto heels, allowing rear end to fall far back with arms and shoulders stretched forward.~Drive hips forward until hips are straight, while keeping arms and shoulders straight. Near top of motion, reach back with arms over head and hyperextend spine. While keeping arms over head, lower body with hips falling back down to starting position and repeat.~An alternative mount involves stepping back with suspension handles in hands until arms are pulled forward about 45° (give or take) from resting position. At this point, recline body back, then fold at hips, allowing rear end to fall far back with arms and shoulders stretched forward. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright. This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQnLFe0mWuOtUKoy6lnmoUIvYFg75L8IHGT97AhgReXY1YBAif50FjhAI9VVaI&amp

1564~33~Suspended Pull Through~Suspended~Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Sit on floor with feet under suspension trainer loops in low position. Reach and grasp bottom of loops and lay back supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles (or ankles through loops as shown). Extend legs out straight. Sit up and place hands on floor to sides at desired distance from suspension trainer. Raise hips from floor, supporting upper body with arms.~Pull hips back while flexing spine in C shape. Raise hips up high by straightening spine and hips until straight.~This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer. See Suspended Supine Feet Mount/Dismount. Erector Spinae is exercised during spinal extension, whereas, Abdominals are exercised during spinal flexion. See Suspended Pull Through for Rectus Abdominis.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQpxMlR1yZQuR57GUi4w8GS4seKu4TWLoGg5n5Kx52s5QehMdCBPmFKgSmqKkw&amp

1565~33~Rear Bridge~Isometric~ Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Sit on mat or floor with legs bent and feet on floor or mat. Place hands back to sides on floor or mat so torso is reclined back slightly.~Raise hips up off floor until hips are straight. Hold position.~Muscles are exercised isometrically.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcThbFIwAmPvb3BIUt-AlZrFvULG4iZXdkE72x6BRQa2JN-ft5OsWK162w5XXw&amp

1566~33~Decline Rear Bridge~Isometric~Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Lie supine on mat with arms to sides. Place feet flat on floor or mat with knees bent.~Raise hips up off floor until hips are straight. Hold position.~Muscles are exercised isometrically.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQotq1PLiYQrsZgMamSh6ZKe0FN05RPvL_-wGlJ4gUkK1d1w3ivNi0qvRRexOU&amp

1567~33~Single Leg Decline Rear Bridge~Isometric~Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Lie supine on mat with arms to sides. Place one foot flat on floor or mat with knee bent. Keep other leg straight. Place arms out to sides of body for stability.~While keeping leg straight inline with body, raise hips up off floor until hip of bent leg is straight. Hold position. Change position and repeat hold on opposite side.~Muscles are exercised isometrically.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSJSXZ8OBtnn4G5JwtDgsNDZu2BZyEanSgNcmxaaSW7rUqYIGgZ8oU1vK9tsw&amp

1568~33~Incline Rear Bridge~Isometric~Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Sit on mat with legs straight and placed together. Place hands back to sides on floor or mat so torso is reclined back slightly.~Raise hips up off floor until hips are straight. Hold position.~Muscles are exercised isometrically.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSEGKq6mkwdn4U4DYzKZegJgsy0p0TJgER-NC4ACU7S_prW1IOtpuWGQphOhhI&amp
1569~33~Cat Stretch~Stretch~~~~~~Also see Cat Movement.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR2wnCr9LVy535xAEdwgjTXsFZoHPE1xuI21AcHnDJNmWLD7Fve1p_VGhKJtw&amp

1570~33~Cat Movement~Stretch~~~~Kneel on mat or floor. Place hands shoulder width apart.~Flex spine by hunching back up. Extend spine by arching back. Repeat.~Also see Cat Stretch.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQgJHY13ysEbDCGMqqsLoPd05jGBaL80Li0p1OOkR3OogFjk_rqwOOU4q3nHA&amp
1571~33~Bent-over Cat Stretch~Stretch~~~~~~ None~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRbY3be6RbZbrxNRmdBG_cJAvkDLMsvF3WnPawNDk1lPB7jQDbXkNtifWxx2Q&amp

1572~33~Lever Lower Back Stretch~Stretch~~~~Sit on seat in forward position with lower legs on shin pad, feet on foot rest. Place hands through wrist straps. Hold upper bar with overhand grip.~Push and lower seat back. Hold stretch.~None~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRNFHvqKUnY4xczmGR_EHxRCq102CPVtVaN3Z1jyk7m5HRZ9ykWM6E1GgQqKaA&amp

1573~33~Lying Lower Back Stretch~Stretch~~~~~~Upper back can also be lifted off of floor to stretch Splenius and cervical portion of Erector Spinae.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcS-blrW4LW9KJvNjWkhINjVVnu8Zuw3252nncAZ4pw8Ci4cbBxbwXS-ypq4Fhg&amp
1574~33~Seated Lower Back Stretch~Stretch~~~~~~Elbows can be lowered to floor.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSoO9Dge5qB4HHqtpdF9G-KCiK5tzkLwkzZWTBFCl0fLGE5SjRd3n1XnbmSdBw&amp
1575~33~Seated Bent-over Lower Back Stretch~Stretch~~~~~~ None~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQjfuDPdifUH-Fcbw8Et2lY7qLQ_Rvw_NRHdcGPqcLurGH4uHOreiNKxq4YPI0&amp

1576~33~Squatting Lower Back Stretch~Stretch~~~~~~Keep knees pointed same direction as toes. The Soleus may be slightly stretched before leaning back.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcS9yEO9QAyTgMNZx9Nh9y-wBv_zsBb39P1Cp2uezHH-mRRniWkoG010ebg2Mo8&amp
1577~33~Plow Stretch~Stretch~~~~~~Avoid overstressing neck anteriorly.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRnfRx7HcNSaeYnRd26PYgnMXzrxYMRBbcjtHsNj9JppH3_h6FoSviu7602uw&amp

1578~34~Barbell Bent Knee Good-morning~Barbell~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.~Keeping back straight, bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.~Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep back straight. Knees will have to bend more with those with less hamstring flexibility. Knees can be kept bent throughout movement. Also see straight leg Goodmorning emphasizing Hamstrings.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQoHMUPNiECnCC_t-p_6X4-ltNLgFwmhRs6KAqhi1DOBPD1-r7KuUscxuG3Uw&amp

1579~34~Barbell Seated Good-morning~Barbell~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Sit on end of bench or corner of box secured to floor. Position feet apart on floor with knees slightly bent.~Keeping back straight, bend torso forward as low as possible by bending hips. Raise torso until torso is upright. Repeat.~Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep back straight. Hamstrings will be emphasized if knees are straight.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT8X07qh2EAe3K1K63ePaxm0LgRDFqF5XJVmOcup1kdhmHVAmMab53BO7_3wg&amp

1580~34~Barbell Deadlift~Barbell~Basic~Compound~Pull~With feet flat beneath bar squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.~Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weights to floor by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.~Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip. Lever barbell jack can be used to lift barbell from floor for easier loading and unload of weight plates.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSolDniAQIvC5RjkVAKkGZV_aQILRdXxOr9R1zrnFXjhec6qIsJwAt0CQog5A&amp

1581~34~Barbell Block Pull~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~With barbell on blocks, position feet shoulder width or slightly narrower beneath bar. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.~Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.~Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQLrKme7L18wOHir4hwFXnNbISUe59CAUJSHsRVpA11iVklgSa-bgL_B76CjOs&amp

1582~34~Barbell Deficit Deadlift~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Stand on weight plate or shallow elevated platform with loaded bar above feet. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.~Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weights to floor by bending hips back, while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.~Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSuMW3tGF6etc3mEdDme-wAvxIpF3jGdXZIPt2kmpo4w6daSf7b81drXCsu0w&amp

1583~34~Barbell Rack Pull~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~In power rack, with barbell on safety bar in low position, place feet shoulder width or slightly narrower beneath bar. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.~Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.~Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRgwEPXyL5TRIluAzj8Es4b99KHGWLW7iWSgDI4pWUrKVhdm8xvDg0j74KFcIs&amp

1584~34~Barbell Sumo Deadlift~Barbell~Basic~Compound~Pull~Position feet under bar with very wide stance. Squat down and grasp bar between legs with shoulder width mixed grip. Face forward while positioning shoulders upward with arms straight, chest high, hips low, and back straight.~Pull bar up by driving feet outward, while pulling chest up. Extend knees when bar passes knees. At top of lift, when torso is upright, drive shoulders back and chest up. Return weight to floor by bending hips back and knees pointed outward, while keeping chest high and back straight. Repeat.~Use shoulder width grip since narrower than shoulder width grip will make it more difficult to lockout at top. Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight, and knees pointed out same direction as feet. Also, keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. With wide stance, push feet out to sides and not down to prevent knees from buckling inward. Pushing knees out will allow hips to travel toward bar more quickly while improving leverage.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSUJ5MCadTDrx3gBADPTfXIx9yoxYOHR1m77mPDmti5DsNG814IiYK62ZXu8a4&amp

1585~34~Barbell Sumo Block Pull~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~With barbell on blocks, position feet under bar with very wide stance. Squat down and grasp bar between legs with shoulder width mixed grip. Face forward while positioning shoulders upward with arms straight, chest high, hips low, and back straight.~Pull bar up by driving feet outward while pulling chest up. Extend knees when bar passes knees. At top of lift, when torso is upright, drive shoulders back and chest up. Return weight to blocks by bending hips back and knees pointed outward, while keeping chest high and back straight. Repeat.~Use shoulder width grip, since narrower than shoulder width grip will make it more difficult to lockout at top. Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight, and knees pointed out same direction as feet. Also, keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. With wide stance, push feet out to sides and not down to prevent knees from buckling inward. Pushing knees out will allow hips to travel toward bar more quickly while improving lev   erage.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQ2bf539otH3ZS7zbN5dzf70tFLxrZyxJ1gZAwJaziG0nEmTKDOSOo4l5dUAA&amp
1586~34~Barbell Stiff Leg Deadlift~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Pull~Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on 5&#34
column3: (13-20 cm) platform with feet flat beneath bar. Bend over and grasp barbell with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.~With knees bent, lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Lower bar to top of feet by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing only slightly at bottom. Repeat.~Throughout lift keep arms and back straight. Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion. Quadriceps can be kept bent throughout movement. See Dangerous Exercise Essay. Also see Straight Back Stiff Leg Deadlift.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcT4H0fv0bjnBDRG7TVj6hHWtmKwGRcqfoZZGm3H2ueNF4XiREr4xS3UopqoM2g&amp

column1: 1587~34~Barbell Single Leg Stiff-leg Deadlift~Barbell~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Hold barbell down in front, arms straight with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Stand with feet together. Lift leg slightly so foot is just off floor.~Lower bar to floor while raising lifted leg back behind. Keep back straight and knee of supporting leg slightly bent. Keep hip and knee of lifted leg extended throughout movement. Once stretch is felt or barbell contacts floor, return to original position by raising torso while lowering lifted leg. Straighten knee of supporting leg as torso becomes upright. Repeat.~Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Those with less flexibility may need to bend knee of supporting leg more so barbell can contact floor. At top of movement, lifted foot can make contact with floor to maintain balance between repetitions.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSIEGRukq0z8Y_hk_rC3BPUXL2nve0PlX4M1nNSM88L2JnHeufUWZyrisPiVQ&amp

1588~34~Barbell Straight-back Stiff-leg Deadlift~Barbell~Auxiliary~Isolated~Pull~Grasp barbell from rack or deadlift from floor with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip. Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance.~With back straight, lower bar to top of feet by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight. Place weight onto floor. With knees still bent, lift bar by straightening hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.~Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Stand on shallow platform if weight reaches floor before stretch. Those with less flexibility may have to bend knees more. Knees can be kept bent throughout movement. Also see Stiff Leg Deadlift and Romanian Deadlift.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTD5zX5DLzyjgKXJDXG8H6o3nyTji3awEozfUJFNI6_mEwVYZSnBAqxfCCOPhY&amp

1589~34~Barbell Hip Thrust~Barbell~Auxiliary~Isolated~Push~Sit on floor with long side of bench behind back. Roll barbell back and center over hips. Position upper back on corner of bench. Place feet on floor approximately shoulder width with knees bent. Grasp bar to each side.~Raise bar upward by extending hips until straight. Lower and repeat.~Use bench of lower height 16&#34
column3: (40 to 46 cm) allowing torso to be angled approximately 45º. Bench may need to be secured so it does not slide on floor.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR4t6pGJAtzqPjJFB5WRD8cPNZgf_3a3gJUU_j4TcoWccjrxe5wU_10_Q0IeE0&amp

column1: 1590~34~Barbell Lunge~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Clean bar from floor or dismount bar from rack. From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.~Lunge forward with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.~Keep torso upright during lunge
column2: flexible hip flexors are important. Lead knee should point same direction as foot throughout lunge. A long lunge emphasizes Gluteus Maximus

column1: 1591~34~Barbell Alternating Lunge & Rear Lunge~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Stand facing rack with barbell at upper chest height and short platform behind. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and step back. Stand with feet slightly narrower than shoulder width apart.~Lunge forward with right leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of right front leg until knee of rear left leg is almost in contact with floor. Forcibly extending hip and knee of forward right leg to return to original standing position.~Keep torso upright throughout exercise. Flexible hip flexors  are important. Lead knee should point same direction as foot throughout lunge. A long lunge emphasizes Gluteus Maximus
column2: short lunge emphasizes Quadriceps. Movement combines Lunge and Rear Lunge.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcThyMmv_ujooRjD4JFc32oxK48ZBmzJh--bR4ERYUAeQDb-j653IrSu7TwpCA&amp

column1: 1592~34~Barbell Alternating Lunge To Rear Lunge~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Stand facing rack with barbell at upper chest height and short platform behind. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and step back. Stand with feet slightly narrower than shoulder width apart.~Lunge forward with right leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of right front leg until knee of rear left leg is almost in contact with floor. Forcibly extending hip and knee of forward right leg to return to upright position. Instead of returning right foot to side of left foot, instead continue to step back with right leg while bending supporting left leg. Plant right forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting left leg until knee of rear right leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to standing position by extending hip and knee of supporting left leg and return rear right leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.~Keep torso upright throughout exercise. Flexible hip flexors  are important. Lead knee should point same direction as foot throughout lunge. A long lunge emphasizes Gluteus Maximus
column2: short lunge emphasizes Quadriceps. Movement combines Lunge and Rear Lunge.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQtjMQftnqsoTCnvEJSWPrsckUaUIvjjKg4yUx1Yd8BXyZ4o32LN9zq2TTe_Q&amp

column1: 1593~34~Barbell Rear Lunge~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack.~Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.~Keep torso upright during lunge
column2: flexible hip flexors are important. Forward knee should point same direction as foot throughout lunge. A long lunge emphasizes Gluteus Maximus

column1: 1594~34~Barbell Side Lunge~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Clean bar from floor or dismount bar from rack. From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.~Lunge to one side with first leg. Land on heel, then on forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of lead leg, keeping knee pointed same direction of foot. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.~Keep torso upright during lunge. Flexible hip adductors will allow fuller range of motion. Lead knee should point same direction as foot throughout lunge. A long lunge emphasizes Gluteus Maximus

1595~34~Barbell Walking Lunge~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.~Step forward with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Stand on forward leg with assistance of rear leg. Lunge forward with opposite leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite legs.~Keep torso upright during lunge
column2: flexible hip flexors are important. Lead knee should point same direction as foot throughout lunge. A long lunge emphasizes Gluteus Maximus
column3: short lunge emphasizes Quadriceps. Tibialis Anterior is exercised eccentrically during landing on heel.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTE0ar2EC2RanwUHFQQoqzSjo_-w9Intv6oM1PtFP5PMe83Q_YDEBakIpLc2_Q&amp

column1: 1596~34~Barbell Single Leg Split Squat~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Stand facing away from bench. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Extend leg back and place top of foot on bench.~Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.~Keep torso upright during squat
column2: flexible hip flexors are important. Forward knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Also see Bulgarian Squat.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQ4vMMThXpK5MsIJPnsxpzYOpeZH7qohqVqcLpxRxaCAaQQavjYJEQ6sMTXV6w&amp

column1: 1597~34~Barbell Side Split Squat~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~~Lower body toward side of angled foot by bending knee and hip of lead leg while keeping opposite leg only slightly bent. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat.~Keep torso upright and knee of lead leg pointed same direction of foot. Flexible hip adductors and stronger legs will allow fuller range of motion. A wider stance emphasizes Gluteus Maximus
column2: slightly narrower straddled stance emphasizes Quadriceps. Do not position feet too close nor too wide.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQQtVQFWZeyHwRLtYol4pK3kJP4Y-I6IjdMq7Pi_KhJ6bv9jM6W1ncAC7Hb80w&amp

column1: 1598~34~Barbell Single Leg Squat~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Stand with arms extended out in front holding barbell. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.~Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep   supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.~Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and glute flexibility. Significant spinal flexion occurs at bottom of deep single leg squat to maintain center of gravity over foot. Erector Spinae becomes a stabilizer if spine is kept straight.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSZgdDdypwM0BJ7oOyea7fRlrj3m2mla4GrVBzXPgOEPnZlQbxMaQNb952fPw&amp
1599~34~Barbell Split Squat~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Stand with feet far apart
column2: one foot forward and other foot behind.~Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.~Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement. Keep torso upright during squat
column3: flexible hip flexors are important. With feet further apart: Gluteus Maximus is emphasized, Quadriceps are less emphasized.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR5a_mJwWY4okdCuCWW4bTBh_3I3mc6ces6B29tHPtVvjrmIrvVBYx24OvQNg&amp

column1: 1600~34~Barbell Squat (low bar)~Barbell~Basic~Compound~Push~From rack with barbell at upper chest height, position bar low on back of shoulders. Grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and stand with wide stance.~~Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor
column2: equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. At bottom of squat, crease at hips must be lower than top of knee cap.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRvc37l0KB4el2IiPzTg2G3kkCHg3nFTWTq8LM4qCdVk8Bu_ydSxlU6okF8p1Y&amp

column1: 1601~34~Barbell Box Squat~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Push~From rack with barbell at upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders. Grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and back up until contact is made with box immediately behind. Stand with wide stance with feet flared out slightly.~Sit back onto box by bending hips back while bending knees, keeping shins nearly perpendicular or knees slightly behind ankles. Lower rear end back onto box in controlled manner. Rock torso back slightly. Once torso rocks forward, immediately stand back up rapidly by driving hips upward, keeping knees above ankles and chest high until legs are straight. Return and repeat.~Try to keep knees from traveling forward while reaching rear end back onto squat box. Ideally, knees could be behind ankles. In this position, greater stretch reflex can be created through hips (via hamstrings) once torso rocks forward just before squat. However, other hip extensors can engage in stretch-shortening cycle (although to lesser extend in this position) in lieu of hamstrings&#39

1602~34~Barbell Front Squat~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar in front of shoulders. Cross arms and place hands on top of barbell with upper arms parallel to floor. Dismount bar from rack.~Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.~Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor
column2: equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See Squat Analysis. Also see weightlifting style Front Squat.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTTCuyV-0BqZaNF7zo6iKroZPdAUJAqEmHXE7F3g137wI8VK6Fqafsb6T4qOA&amp

column1: 1603~34~Barbell Full Squat~Barbell~Basic~Compound~Push~From rack with barbell upper chest height, position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Dismount bar from rack.~Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until knees and hips are fully bent. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.~Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor
column2: equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Hip and ankle flexibility is important for both execution and safety in this movement. See Full Squat Flexibility. Certain knee and low back problems may be aggravated by this exercise. See Full Squat Analysis and Deep Squat Test. See spotting technique and spotting assistance.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRR-8fjQco2y71oGmvxM8Ag-xo1uvLm5VNK9SPI7c8JG-PpG6_JPhKGYyd2qDo&amp

column1: 1604~34~Barbell Hack Squat~Barbell~Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Position barbell just behind legs. With feet flat on floor, squat down and grasp barbell from behind with overhand grip.~Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Squat down by bending knees forward while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are close to parallel to floor and bar is behind lower leg. Repeat.~Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See flawed demonstration showing depth of hack squat that is NOT sufficient and knees are NOT pointed same angle as feet. Individuals with short arm to torso ratio or protracted shoulder posture, may find this exercise very difficult to perform. See Squat Analysis.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR8ycG1yvltaHfzRArAfVDeHmUuvRkYGM3VbMm9KTsnSy3_wgN_KcsMiShQ-w&amp

1605~34~Safety Barbell Squat~Barbell~Basic~Compound~Push~Standing facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Hands can be placed on ends of yoke (as shown) or on safety bar out to sides. Dismount bar from rack and step back.~Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend slightly forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand by extending hips and knees until legs are straight. Repeat.~Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor
column2: equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Exercise can also be performed holding onto supports or with long handled safety bar. Also see Squat Analysis.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcS0w7GO57chLpLLx5OMGLbLIPsAphGo7rI2QR6qYn0kVY_2zoSe4_YbSufYBnY&amp

column1: 1606~34~Safety Barbell Squat (long handles)~Barbell~Basic~Compound~Push~Standing facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Grasp ends of handles. Dismount bar from rack and step back.~Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend slightly forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand with or without assistance of arms, extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.~Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor
column2: equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Exercise can also be performed holding onto supports or with safety bar without bar handles. Also see Squat Analysis.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTWorAb3tT-Co_HnEJC5TYEfmjiXCrp1sUR3su1cjgDlFnWia7m6400mIBk0w&amp

column1: 1607~34~Safety Barbell Squat (self-spotting)~Barbell~~~~~~Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor
column2: equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. If handles are not available, horizontal bars on rack can be used for assistance if needed. Exercise can also be performed without holding onto supports. Also see Squat Analysis.~https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSSfgzjuMXFnknI1kBe0hNfSZsXsjqna2bC1LcYOOe3Rc2zskEvaJNg80uU05g&amp

column1: 1608~34~Trap Bar Squat~Barbell~Basic or Auxiliary~Compound~Push~Stand on platform under loaded trap bar.
